variant.name: Background
variant.summary: Install happens in background shortly after login. This installation increases the probability that the DLC package is installed by the time ambient mode is actually launched.

variant.name: Foreground
variant.summary: Install that happens when it's time to launch ambient mode with one of the video themes. If this install fails, ambient mode will fail to render. If the background install has already succeeded at some point in the past, this foreground install should be very quick and always succeed.

variant.name: Crashed
variant.summary: The device crashes, it includes the case when the battery is empty and powerd does not have time to perform a graceful shutdown.

variant.name: LowBatteryShutdown
variant.summary: The device automatically shuts down due to a low battery.

variant.name: PluggedIn
variant.summary: The device connects to a power source.

variant.name: Suspended
variant.summary: The device enters a suspended state.

variant.name: UserShutdown
variant.summary: The device is shut down gracefully by the user.

variant.name: Shared
variant.summary: Files most recently shared with user

variant.name: Total
variant.summary: Total time to run all queries

variant.summary: Request from Mahi provider for outline

variant.name: MahiProvider.QA

variant.name: MahiProvider.Summary

variant.name: UserInitiatedTablet

variant.name: SnapByFullRestoreOrDeskTemplateOrSavedDesk

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Actions.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record which shortcuts are being used for an action. Fires when the use perform an action using a keyboard shortcut. A shortcut is encoded as an int where the high 16 bits represent all the modifiers used, and the 0-15 bits represent which key is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.ActivateDeskByIndex
histogram.summary: Record which desk the user switches to. Fires when the user switches desk to a specific index using a keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.ToggleHighContrast
histogram.summary: Toggling the high contrast display mode has two accelerators: - Search+Shift+H which is deprecated. - Ctrl+Search+H which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Rotation.Usage
histogram.summary: Captures the result of a user using the rotation accelerator - Ctrl+Shift+Refresh. This histogram shows how frequently users accidentally hit the key combination.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.TogglePicker.Action
histogram.summary: Action triggered by pressing toggle picker accelerator.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.WindowSnap
histogram.summary: Captures usage of Alt+[ and Alt+].

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.Activation.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Ambient mode is entered from {TabletOrClamshell}. AmbientUiMode indicates whether the user entered Ambient mode from the lock screen or from screen idle.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.AnimationSmoothness.PhotoTransition
histogram.summary: Emitted when the ambient mode photo transition animation completes to report the smoothness of this animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.Enabled
histogram.summary: Among eligible users, whether the user has Ambient mode enabled. Recorded once for every UMA upload. The set of eligible users includes all users with profiles that can allow Ambient mode to be enabled. This is limited by profile type, whether the user is primary, if the user has a supported email, etc.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.EngagementTime.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the length of each session for {Settings}. The metric is emitted when ambient mode is ended.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.EngagementTime.{Settings}.{Orientation}
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the accumulated duration spent in {Orientation} mode during a single ambient mode session rendering the {Settings} UI. For example, say ambient mode starts in landscape for A ms, switches to portrait for B ms, then back to landscape for C ms before ambient mode ends. A + C will be emitted for landscape mode, and B will be emitted for portrait mode. Emitted once per observed orientation each time the user exits ambient mode.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.EngagementTime.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the length of each session. The metric is emitted when ambient mode is ended. 2 new animated ambient mode themes have been added started in M104.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.Init.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Background initialization tasks must be completed successfully before the ambient UI can be launched. For example, slide show mode must download an initial set of photos from the server before the UI can be rendered. This records the initialization success/failure count per ambient setting; each ambient setting (slide show, video, etc) has a different initialization process. This is emitted each time ash tries to launch the ambient UI.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.LottieAnimationSmoothness.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Emitted periodically while {Settings} is rendering in ambient mode. 100% represents ideal smoothness.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.PhotoSource
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the source of ambient mode photos. Recorded once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.ScreenCount.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the number of screens present during a {Settings} ambient mode session. Emitted each time ambient mode exits.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.SelectedNumberOfAlbums
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the selected number of personal photo albums. Recorded once only when users make a selection on the personal photo albums on Settings page.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.StartupTime.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time it takes for {Settings} in ambient mode to start. This includes tasks such as downloading an initial set of photos from IMAX server, decoding them, loading the animation from resource pak, etc. Note this measurement does not include the lock screen inactivity timeout (currently 7 seconds). So ideally, this should be 0. Also note that ambient mode should start after a 10 second timeout if at least 1 photo has been downloaded from IMAX. Hitting the 10 second timeout is considered non-ideal, but acceptable behavior. However, anything over that is very bad. Thus, this histogram has a 15 second maximum (added a 5 second buffer to the timeout just to be safe). Anything over the 15 second maximum goes in the overflow bucket and is considered a total failure to start ambient mode. This should be extremely rare. Emitted each time the {Settings} UI starts rendering, or when ambient mode exits in the event that the UI never started rendering.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.TopicSource
histogram.summary: Emitted when screen saver starts running. Logs the topic source of the screen saver.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.TotalNumberOfAlbums
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the total number of personal photo albums. Recorded once only when users make a selection on the personal photo albums on Settings page.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.VideoDlcInstall.{Label}.Error
histogram.summary: Records the type of error that is received from DLC Service when an installation is requested for the ambient video package. This is emitted after each ambient DLC installation attempt. See comments above AmbientVideoDlcInstallLabels for when installation attempts are made.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.VideoPlaybackStatus.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of each ambient mode session that renders {Settings}. Only applies to ambient video themes. Tracks whether video playback started successfully in each ambient video session. Ideally, there are nothing but success and loading statuses being recorded (the latter should be rare because it means the user killed the session right as the video was being loaded).

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.VideoSmoothness.{Settings}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of each ambient mode session that renders {Settings}. Only applies to ambient video themes. Tracks the total number of frames created divided by the total number of frames expected during the entire ambient session. 100% represents ideal smoothness, and any deviation from that is due to dropped video frames. This metric requires a minimum of ~5 seconds of playback (~100 expected videos frames) to be recorded; ambient video sessions shorter than that are not statistically significant enough to record and will not be tracked. As such, this metric is just a general gauge of the video's performance in the field. Separate fine-grained metrics tracking rebuffering frequency and duration may be added in the future.

histogram.name: Ash.ArcAppInitialAppsInstallDuration
histogram.summary: For each user after they opted-in into ARC++, records the duration of initial apps installation. Duration is measured as an interval between the opt-in and the moment when all default apps become either "ready" or "update error". This is only reported within the same opt-in session, and is not reported if default apps were not installed within the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Assistant.AnimationSmoothness{AshAssistantAnimationSmoothness}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of assistant related animations. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. {AshAssistantAnimationSmoothness}

variant.name: .CardElement
variant.summary: Animation for showing and hiding card responses

variant.name: .SuggestionChip
variant.summary: Animation for showing and hiding suggestion chips

variant.name: .TextElement
variant.summary: Animation for showing and hiding text response

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthClosedDuringAuth
histogram.summary: Records when the active session auth dialog closed during authentication. It means the user already submitted their password or pin, but didn't wait for the result. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthClosedWithSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the success outcome of the authentication on the active session auth dialog. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthFailed
histogram.summary: Records the authentication input type when authentication fails on the active session dialog. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthFingerprintAttempt
histogram.summary: The number of fingerprint attempts while the active session auth dialog was opened. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthOpenDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time the active session auth dialog remained opened. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthPasswordAttempt
histogram.summary: The number of password attempts while the active session auth dialog was opened. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthPinAttempt
histogram.summary: The number of pin attempts while the active session auth dialog was opened. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthStart
histogram.summary: Records the authentication input type when authentication happened. Recorded when the authentication starts on the active session auth dialog.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionAuthSucceeded
histogram.summary: Records the authentication input type when authentication succeeded. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionPasswordlessAuthClosedWithSuccess
histogram.summary: Records successful passwordless user authentications. Recorded when the active session auth dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Auth.ActiveSessionShowReason
histogram.summary: Records the authentication reason why the active session auth dialog was opened. Recorded when the active session auth dialog opens.

histogram.name: Ash.BackGesture.EndScenarioType
histogram.summary: End scenario type while swiping back from the left side of the window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.BackGesture.StartScenarioType
histogram.summary: Start scenario type while swiping back from the left side of the window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.BackGesture.UnderneathWindowType
histogram.summary: Underneath window type while swiping back from the left side of the window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.BatterySaver.BatteryPercent{BatteryPercentWhen}
histogram.summary: The battery charge percent when {BatteryPercentWhen}

variant.name: .DisabledSettings
variant.summary: disabled via the device settings page.

variant.name: .EnabledSettings
variant.summary: enabled via the device settings page.

histogram.name: Ash.BatterySaver.Duration{DurationWhen}
histogram.summary: How long battery saver was enabled. Logged when {DurationWhen}

variant.name: .DisabledSettings
variant.summary: disabled via the device settings page.

variant.name: .EnabledNotification
variant.summary: disabled after being enabled via notification.

variant.name: .EnabledSettings
variant.summary: disabled after being enabled via the device settings page.

histogram.name: Ash.BatterySaver.TimeToEmpty{TimeToEmptyWhen}
histogram.summary: The battery time to empty when battery saver is {TimeToEmptyWhen}. Only logged when an estimate is available.

variant.name: .DisabledSettings
variant.summary: disabled via the device settings page

variant.name: .EnabledSettings
variant.summary: enabled via the device settings page

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Bar.Activate
histogram.summary: Records true if the user clicks on any chip on the birch bar.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Bar.Impression
histogram.summary: Records true if the user was presented with the birch bar and it had one or more chips visible.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Chip.Activate
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user clicks or taps on a chip of a given type.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Chip.ActivatedRanking
histogram.summary: The ranking of a chip from the triggers and priorities specification. Recorded when the user clicks or taps on a chip.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Chip.Activate{When}
histogram.summary: The type of the chip the user clicked or tapped. Recorded the {When} time the user clicks or taps on a chip in a login session.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Chip.Hidden
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user hides a suggestion.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Chip.Impression
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user is shown a chip of a given type.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.ChipCount
histogram.summary: The number of chips when the birch bar is shown to the user. May be zero if there were no chips to show.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Coral.Action
histogram.summary: Recorded when a coral cluster is restored, launched to a new desk, and saved as a desk templated.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Coral.ClusterCount
histogram.summary: The number of coral items shown in the birch bar when the user enters overview.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Coral.ClusterExpanded
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user expands a coral BirchChipButton. Can be recorded multiple times during the lifetime of the BirchChipButton.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Coral.ClusterItemRemoved
histogram.summary: The number of coral items removed by user from the chevron expanded menu.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Coral.UserFeedback
histogram.summary: Record the thumbs up/thumbs down feedback for coral grouping suggestion from the user. Emits true if the feedback is positive, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Latency{Type}
histogram.summary: The latency to fetch data of {Type} type via the data provider. Recorded once per fetch (i.e. once per time the birch bar is shown).

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.ProviderHidden{Type}
histogram.summary: Whether the user is hiding birch results of {Type} type. Recorded on startup.

variant.name: .ChromeTabs
variant.summary: recent tabs, last active tab, most visited tab, and self-share tabs

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.Ranking{Time}
histogram.summary: The ranking (lower is better) of the birch results shown to user during {Time}. Recorded when the birch chips are shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.ResultsReturned{Type}
histogram.summary: The number of results of {Type} type returned by the data provider. The results were not necessarily shown to the user (based on ranking).

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.TotalLatency
histogram.summary: The total latency to fetch all birch data via all data providers. Recorded once per fetch (i.e. once per time the birch bar is shown).

histogram.name: Ash.Birch.TotalLatencyPostLogin
histogram.summary: The total latency to fetch all birch data via all data providers on the first fetch post login. Recorded when the birch bar is shown post login.

histogram.name: Ash.Boca.NumberOfActiveStudentsWhenSessionEnded
histogram.summary: Records the number of active students left when the session ends.

histogram.name: Ash.Boca.NumberOfStudentsJoinedViaCodeDuringSession
histogram.summary: Records the number of students joined via code throughout a session.

histogram.name: Ash.Boca.OnTask.MaxNumberOfTabsDuringSession
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of tabs shared by the provider throughout a session.

histogram.name: Ash.Boca.OnTask.NumberOfTabsWhenSessionEnded
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs shared by the provider when the session ends.

histogram.name: Ash.Boca.OnTask.{State}SessionDurationPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the duration the session was in {State}.

histogram.name: Ash.Boca.PollingResult
histogram.summary: Records scheduled boca session polling result from out of and in-session.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserContext.UnexpectedGetPrimaryUserProfile
histogram.summary: Making sure nobody in the production calls the ProfileManager::GetPrimaryUserProfile() in unexpected timing. This entry will not have "false" status.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeBetweenDataMigrations
histogram.summary: The time elapsed from the completion of a successful forward migration to the start of a backward migration, with a maximum of 24 days. Recorded every time backward migration is started, if forward migration was performed prior to it.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeDeleteAshItems
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while DeleteAshItems() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeDeleteLacrosDir
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while DeleteLacrosDir() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeDeleteTmpDir
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while DeleteTmpDir() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeMergeSplitItems
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while MergeSplitItems() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeMoveLacrosItemsToAshDir
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while MoveLacrosItemsToAshDir() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimeMoveMergedItemsBackToAsh
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while MoveMergedItemsBackToAsh() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.ElapsedTimePreMigrationCleanUp
histogram.summary: The time in ms that elapsed while PreMigrationCleanUp() was run. Recorded once when browser data backward migration happens if the step succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: The final status of browser data backward migration. Recorded once at the end of the migration process. It is collected to monitor whether backward migration is working, and if it is not to determine which step is failing.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.IsPrecededByForwardMigration
histogram.summary: Whether forward migration was performed before backward migration. True if the user was first on Ash, then moved to Lacros (forward migration), and then back to Ash (backward migration). False if the user started with Lacros (no forward migration) and then moved to Ash (backward migration). Recorded every time backward migration is started, if forward migration was performed prior to it.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.NumberOfLacrosSecondaryProfiles
histogram.summary: The number of Lacros secondary profiles at the time of starting the backward migration process. Recorded every time migration is started.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.PosixErrno.{TaskStatus}
histogram.summary: Recorded when browser data backward migration fails. Records the errno set by the operation that caused the migration to fail. `TaskStatus` is used to determine the step in which the error occurred.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataBackMigrator.SuccessfulMigrationTime
histogram.summary: How long the backward migration took to complete in ms. Only recorded if migration succeeds.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunAshDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is identified to belong to ash-chrome i.e. the total size of files that are under profile data directory of ash-chrome that should remain in the same directory.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunCommonDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is duplicated in both ash and lacros data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunExtraDiskSpaceOccupiedByMove
histogram.summary: The size of data that will be created due to profile migration. Note that this value is only an estimate.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunExtraDiskSpaceOccupiedByMove.LowDiskUser2
histogram.summary:
The size of data that will be created due to profile migration.
Only collected for users that cannot secure 100MB extra space buffer for profile migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunFreeDiskSpace.LowDiskUser2
histogram.summary:
Free disk space available under profile directory.
Only collected for users that cannot secure 100MB extra space buffer for profile migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunFreeDiskSpaceAfterDelete
histogram.summary: Free disk space available under profile directory after deleting deletable items.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunFreeDiskSpaceAfterDelete.LowDiskUser2
histogram.summary:
Free disk space available under profile directory after deleting deletable items.
Only collected for users that cannot secure 100MB extra space buffer for profile migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunFreeDiskSpaceAfterMigration
histogram.summary: The size of disk space after profile migration. If the value is negative that means the user currently are short of disk space by that amount.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunLacrosDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is identified to belong to lacros-chrome i.e. the total size of files that are under profile data directory of ash-chrome that should move to lacros data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunMyFilesDirSize.LowDiskUser2
histogram.summary:
The total size of data inside the 'MyFiles' directory.
Only collected for users that cannot secure 100MB extra space buffer for profile migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunNoCopyDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is identified to be deletable such as cache.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunProfileDirSize.LowDiskUser2
histogram.summary:
The total size of data inside the profile directory.
Only collected for users that cannot secure 100MB extra space buffer for profile migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.CancelledMigrationTime
histogram.summary: The time taken for profile migration before it is cancelled by the user during move migration. Profile move migration happens once after Lacros and move migration is enabled. This only gets recorded if the user clicks "Skip" from the migration UI displayed during the migration. Profile move migration is a feature to migrate profile data from Ash to Lacros once after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.ExtraDiskSpaceOccupied
histogram.summary: The size of disk space occupied by files/dirs created during the migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.ExtraDiskSpaceOccupied.DiffWithEstimate
histogram.summary: The difference between the estimate and the actual size of disk space occupied by files/dirs created during the migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.ExtraSpaceRequiredMB
histogram.summary: This is recorded if move profile migration is aborted due to the lack of extra space required on disk. The amount of space required to be freed is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.MaxResumeReached
histogram.summary: Recorded for users who've reached the maximum number of resumes `kMoveMigrationResumeCountLimit`. This entry will not have "false" status.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.MoveLacrosItemsTime
histogram.summary: The time taken for move migration to run MoveLacrosItemsToNewDir(). Recorded once during the migration. Profile move migration is a feature to migrate profile data from Ash to Lacros once after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.PosixErrno.{TaskStatus}
histogram.summary: Recorded when profile move migration fails. Profile move migration happens once after Lacros and move migration is enabled. Records the errno set by the operation that caused the migration to fail. `TaskStatus` is used to determine which step the error occurred. Profile move migration is a feature to migrate profile data from Ash to Lacros once after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.PreMigrationCleanUpTime
histogram.summary: The time taken for move migration to run PreMigrationCleanUp() and recorded once when profile move migration happens. Profile move migration migrates profile data from Ash to Lacros after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.ResumeCount
histogram.summary: The number of times move migration was resumed. Resume means that the previous migrations were interrupted mid way and had to be resumed from where it was left off.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.ResumeStep
histogram.summary: The step from which move migration is resumed from. Recorded once at the beginning of profile move migration. Profile move migration gets resumed from where it left off if the previous attempt were did not finish completely. Profile move migration migrates profile data from Ash to Lacros after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.SetupLacrosDirCopyTargetItemsTime
histogram.summary: The time taken for move migration to copy target items inside SetupLacrosDir(). Recorded once during profile move migration. Profile move migration is a feature to migrate profile data from Ash to Lacros once after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.SuccessfulMigrationTime
histogram.summary: The time taken for profile move migration to complete in ms. Recorded once at the end of the migration if it is successful. Profile move migration is a feature to migrate profile data from Ash to Lacros once after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.TaskStatus
histogram.summary: The final status of profile move migration. Recorded once at the end of the migration process. Profile move migration is a feature to migrate profile data from Ash to Lacros once after Lacros is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.TmpProfileDirSize
histogram.summary: The size of temporary profile directory created during the migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.MoveMigrator.TmpSplitDirSize
histogram.summary: The size of temporary split directory created during the migration.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.CalendarKeyboardNavigationSource
histogram.summary: Records which keys are used when the user navigates the Monthly Calendar View accessible from Quick Settings and system tray with the keyboard. Triggered when user shifts focus from a Calendar element to another by pressing tab, or when navigating Calendar Date Cells with the arrow keys.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.EventListView.JoinMeetingButton.Pressed
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Join" meeting button is pressed from the Calendar "EventListView" i.e. the user opens the sys tray calendar, taps todays date cell, then scrolls to the event and taps the "Join" meeting button.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.EventListViewJelly.EventDisplayedCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of currently visible events shown to the user when the Calendar Event List view displays in one day. i.e. the user opens the sys tray calendar, clicks on a date cell and sees 2 events, this metric will track a count of 2.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.EventsDisplayedToUser
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user sees any calendar event in the CalendarView. Recorded once per lifetime of the calendar view.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.FetchCalendars.TotalSelectedCalendars
histogram.summary: Recorded when a fetched calendar list is filtered for selected calendars. Records the number of calendars in the response that are selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.FetchEvents.PreFetched
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever calendar events are requested, and no fetch is required because the fetch has already returned.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.FetchEvents.SingleMonthSize
histogram.summary: Recorded when there are no outstanding calendar event fetches for a month. The total size of the month's events.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.FetchEvents.TotalCacheSizeMonths
histogram.summary: Recorded when the calendar is closed. The total number of months cached for calendar events while it was open.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.FetchEvents.TotalFetchDuration
histogram.summary: Recorded when the final calendar event fetch for a month returns and Multi- Calendar is enabled. Records the time elapsed from the first fetch that is started to the last fetch that is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.Fetch{DataType}s.FetchDuration
histogram.summary: Recorded when the {DataType} fetch returns. The duration of the fetch request.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.Fetch{DataType}s.Result
histogram.summary: Recorded when the {DataType} fetch returns. The recorded enum value indicates the return code of the fetch request.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.Fetch{DataType}s.Timeout
histogram.summary: Recorded when {DataType}s are requested and the request goes too long without a response.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.MaxDistanceBrowsed
histogram.summary: Records the maximum absolute distance from today that a user has browsed in the calendar. Recorded when the calendar is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.MonthDwellTime
histogram.summary: Records the time a user spends in a calendar month. Records the time when the user either scrolls to another month or closes the CalendarView.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.ScrollSource
histogram.summary: The source of scrolling in calendar view. Recorded when the calendar is scrolled and changed to another month (note that scrolls resulting in no month change are not recorded).

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.ShowSource.{ViewShowSource}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the calendar view is shown from the {ViewShowSource}.

variant.name: TimeView
variant.summary: time view in the status area

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.TimeToSeeTodaysEventDots
histogram.summary: Measures the time from open of CalendarView, to CalendarDateCellView representing today receives events. Recorded once per lifetime of CalendarViewController (once per show), when todays CalendarDateCellView receives event data.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.TimeToSeeTodaysEventDotsForMultiCalendar
histogram.summary: Measures the time from open of CalendarView, to CalendarDateCellView representing today receives events when Multi-Calendar is enabled. Recorded once per lifetime of CalendarViewController (once per show), when todays CalendarDateCellView receives event data.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.UpNextView.EventDisplayedCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of currently visible upcoming events shown to the user when the Calendar "Up next" view displays. i.e. the user opens the sys tray calendar, "Up next" displays 2 upcoming events, this metric will track a count of 2.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.UpNextView.EventListItem.Pressed
histogram.summary: Recorded when an upcoming event is pressed from the Calendar "Up next" view and launched in Google Calendar. i.e. the user opens the sys tray calendar, "Up next" displays an event in the next 10 mins and the user taps the event.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.UpNextView.JoinMeetingButton.Pressed
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Join" meeting button is pressed from the Calendar "Up next" view i.e. the user opens the sys tray calendar, "Up next" displays an event in the next 10 mins and the user taps "Join" meeting button on the event.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.UserAction
histogram.summary: User actions recorded when the user interacts with Calendar in Chrome OS System UI.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.UserActionToOpenCalendarWebUi
histogram.summary: User actions in Chrome OS Calendar System UI that result in Google Calendar web UI being opened. Recorded when the user interacts with the Chrome OS Calendar System UI.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.UserJourneyTime.{EventLaunchState}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the calendar view is destroyed, records the lifetime of the CalendarView object, which corresponds with the user journey time of the calendar.

histogram.name: Ash.Calendar.{CalendarChildView}.Activated
histogram.summary: Recorded when the {CalendarChildView} is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.CloseEventList.{CalendarChildView}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Recorded when the close event list animation is finished.

variant.name: CalendarSlidingSurface
variant.summary: calendar sliding surface container for event list and up next

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.ConstructionTime
histogram.summary: The time to build the CalendarView, recorded when CalendarView is constructed, which happens every time the calendar is shown from the status area.

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.FadeInUpNextView.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness recorded when the up next view fades in. 60 fps is 100% smoothness and so ideally we should see smoothness > 80%.

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.FadeOutUpNextView.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness recorded when the up next view fades out. 60 fps is 100% smoothness and so ideally we should see smoothness > 80%.

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.OnMonthChanged.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Recorded when the on month changed animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.OpenEventList.{CalendarChildView}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Recorded when the open event list animation is finished on the {CalendarChildView}. The metric is expired from 2023-02-18 to 2023-03-15, so it's possible some data is dropped during that time.

variant.name: CalendarSlidingSurface
variant.summary: calendar sliding surface container for event list and up next

variant.name: UpNextView
variant.summary: if up next view is showing, track animating from it to the event list view opening

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.ScrollOneMonth.{CalendarChildView}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Recorded when the scroll one month animation is finished on the {CalendarChildView}.

histogram.name: Ash.CalendarView.{Animation}.{CalendarChildView}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Recorded when the {Animation} animation is finished on the {CalendarChildView}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.AudioRecordingMode.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the end of a capture mode session in {TabletOrClamshell} to report the user's audio recording mode setting, only if video recording was selected, and the recording type supports audio recording.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.BarButtons.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a button from the bar widget displayed in Capture mode is pressed in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the type of the button pressed.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CameraDisconnectionsDuringRecordings.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the number of camera disconnections in {TabletOrClamshell} during recording.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CameraReconnectDuration.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records how many seconds it takes a camera that got disconnected to get reconnected again within the grace period in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CaptureConfiguration.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user performs a screen capture in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum indicates the configuration used for the capture. I.e. the capture source and the capture type.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CaptureRegionAdjusted.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user is in a region capture session in {TabletOrClamshell} and performs a capture or they switch the capture source. The recorded count indicates the number of times the user adjusts the region. This counts each time they move the region or resize it. It is reset whenever a user creates a new region or the count is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ConsecutiveScreenshots
histogram.summary: Records the number of consecutive screenshots the user takes within 5s of each other, regardless of capture options.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.DemoToolsEnabledOnRecordingStart.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records whether a capture mode video recording starts with demo tools feature enabled or not in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.EndRecordingReason.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever capture mode screen recording is ended in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the reason that lead to ending the screen recording.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.EntryPoint.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Capture mode is entered from {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the method used to enter Capture mode.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.GameDashboard.SaveLocation.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the screen capture is saved in {TabletOrClamshell} when captured by the Game Dashboard intiated capture session. The recorded enum value indicates the location that the screen capture is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.GameDashboard.ScreenRecordingFileSize.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the size of the successfully recorded WebM file by the Game Dahboard initiated capture mode in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.GIFRecordingFileSize.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the size of the successfully recorded GIF file by capture mode in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.GIFRecordingLength.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the time of a successful GIF recording in capture mode in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved. The upper limit of this histogram is 3 hours.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.GIFRecordingRegionToScreenRatio.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the percent ratio between the area of the user selected region for GIF recording to the area of the full screen in {TabletOrClamshell}. Emitted only when GIF recording is about to start.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.MultimodalSearchRequest.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a multimodal search request is made in the search results panel in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.NumberOfConnectedCameras
histogram.summary: Records the number of connected cameras to the device whenever it changes.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.Projector.CaptureRegionAdjusted.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user is in a region capture session in {TabletOrClamshell} entered from the projector app and performs a capture or they switch the capture source. The recorded count indicates the number of times the user adjusts the region. This counts each time they move the region or resize it. It is reset whenever a user creates a new region or the count is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.QuickAction
histogram.summary: Track all quick actions on screenshot notification. Including: Edit in backlight, Go to Files, Delete File.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.RecordingCameraPositionOnStart.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the camera preview position when the recording is started in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.RecordingCameraSizeOnStart.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the camera size when the recording is started in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.RecordingStartsWithCamera.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records whether a capture mode video recording starts with camera or not in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SaveLocation.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever screen capture is saved in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the location that the screen capture is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenRecordingFileSize.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the size of the successfully recorded WebM file by capture mode in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved, or if it was recorded for Projector.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenRecordingLength.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the time of a successful video recording in capture mode in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved. The upper limit of this histogram is 3 hours.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenshotsPerDay
histogram.summary: Records the number of screenshots that have been taken via the CaptureModeController every 24 hours. Note that counts are not persisted across crashes, restarts, or sessions so this is only intended to give a rough approximation.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenshotsPerWeek
histogram.summary: Records the number of screenshots that have been taken via the CaptureModeController every 7 days. Note that counts are not persisted across crashes, restarts, or sessions so this is only intended to give a rough approximation. This means that this metric will only be recorded in sessions spanning at least 7 days.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SearchButtonPressed.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the Search button is pressed in a default capture session in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SearchButtonShown.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the Search button is shown to a user in a default capture session in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SearchResultClicked.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a search result URL was clicked in the search results panel in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SearchResultsPanelEntryPoint.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the search results panel is created during a capture session, either due to selecting a region (without an existing panel) in a Sunfish session, or clicking the search button in a default session. The recorded enum value indicates the entry point.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SearchResultsPanelShown.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the search results panel was shown, including panel creation, region adjustment, and region reselection, in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SwitchesFromInitialCaptureMode
histogram.summary: Emits true if a user has switched capture modes (fullscreen, region, window) while in a capture mode session, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SwitchToDefaultReason.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the capture folder is switched to default downloads folder in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the reason that leads to the switching.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.{Client}.AudioRecordingMode.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the end of a {Client}-initiated capture mode session in {TabletOrClamshell} to report the user's audio recording mode setting, only if video recording was selected, and the recording type supports audio recording.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.{Client}.CaptureConfiguration.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a {Client}-initiated a screen capture is performed in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum indicates the configuration used for the Game Dashboard initiated capture, i.e. the capture source and the capture type.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.{Client}.DemoToolsEnabledOnRecordingStart.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records whether a {Client}-initiated recording starts with demo tools feature enabled or not in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.{Client}.RecordingStartsWithCamera.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records whether a {Client}-initiated recording starts with camera on or not in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.{Client}.ScreenRecordingLength.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the time of a successful video recording in capture mode entered from the client session in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved. The upper limit of this histogram is 3 hours.

histogram.name: Ash.ContentTransfer.AuthenticationResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of webview authentication when it finishes. Allows for tracking the authentication success rate. Recorded for ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.ContentTransfer.FlowState
histogram.summary: Records the state at which the Content Transfer app was exited by the user. Allows for tracking the drop rate at different stages of the flow. Recorded for ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.ContentTransfer.ShowNudgeFailed
histogram.summary: Recorded when showing the Content Transfer app nudge to a user has failed. Recorded for ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.ContextualGoogleIntegrations.{IntegrationName}.Status
histogram.summary: Records the contextual Google integration status (whether it's enabled, or disabled because of policy / app / URL block).

histogram.name: Ash.DarkTheme.SystemTray.IsDarkModeEnabled
histogram.summary: Emitted true when the user switched to dark mode through toggling the (Dark theme) feature pod button inside system tray menu. Emitted false if the user switched to light mode through toggling this button. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskApi.CloseAllUndo
histogram.summary: Emitted after a virtual desk being removed by Desk API and undo toast being clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskApi.RemoveDeskType
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is removed by Desk Api to specify the category of this remove operation among close all, combine desk, and close all and wait.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskApi.{Method}.Result
histogram.summary: Recorded when a desk API {Method} method succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationLatency.DeskActivation
histogram.summary: Emitted when the virtual desks activation animation begins, to report the latency of starting this animation. In a continuous desk animation, this metric is recorded only for the first desk switch.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationLatency.DeskRemoval
histogram.summary: Emitted when the virtual desks removal animation begins, to report the latency of starting this animation. In a continuous desk animation, this metric is recorded only for the first desk switch.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationSmoothness.DeskActivation
histogram.summary: Emitted when the virtual desks activation animation completes to report the smoothness of this animation when running on the display on which the active window resides (if any) or the display of the primary root window. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationSmoothness.DeskEndGesture
histogram.summary: When a four finger touchpad swipe has ended, an animation to the nearest desk will occur. This histogram is emitted when that animation finishes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationSmoothness.DeskRemoval
histogram.summary: Emitted when the virtual desks removal animation completes to report the smoothness of this animation when running on the display on which the active window resides (if any) or the display of the primary root window. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AssignToAllDesksSource
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window is assigned to all desks. E.g. `Move to Desks menu` which can be accessed from a window's context menu or keyboard shortcuts. This is not emitted when a window is unassigned from all desks. As of M99, this should be used as the source of truth for the usage of the assign to all desks feature.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.CloseAllTotal
histogram.summary: Emitted after a virtual desk being removed with close all option and undo toast being shown. This metric describes the total number of times the user chooses to close a desk with its windows, regardless of whether that action is undone.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.CloseAllUndo
histogram.summary: Emitted after a virtual desk being removed with close all option and undo toast being clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.ConsecutiveDailyVisits
histogram.summary: Emitted when a desk is destroyed or a user activates a desk they haven't visited the prior day. In the former case, reports the number of consecutive days a user visited the newly-closed desk. In the latter case, reports the number of consecutive days a user visited the desk during the previous visit. This metric is persisted across multiple sessions and restarts. I.e. if a user logs out and logs back in their desk's consecutive daily visits will be restored. This metric uses the user's local timezone so if they move back in time via timezone change, this metric will be reset.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.CustomNameCount
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user with more than one desk changes the name of a desk to specify how many of the user's desks have custom names.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.CustomNameCreated
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user with more than one desk confirms the name of a desk to specify how often users create custom names.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.CustomNamePercentage
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user with more than one desk changes the name of a desk to specify the percentage of the user's desks that have custom names.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DeskButton.DeskBar.Enter.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the desk button desk bar enter event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DeskButton.DeskBar.Exit.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the desk button desk bar exit event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DeskButton.HiddenByUser
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user decides to hide the desk button to specify how often users are deliberately choosing to hide the button.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DeskButton.Presses
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user presses on the central button on the desk button to specify how often users are using the center button to open or close the desk bar.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DeskLifetime_{DeskIndex}
histogram.summary: The lifetime of the desk at index {DeskIndex} (1-indexed). Emitted when a desk is removed. This metric is persisted across multiple sessions and restarts. I.e. if a user logs out and logs back in their desk's lifetime will be restored.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksCount3
histogram.summary: Emitted when there's a change in the virtual desks count whether due to desk creation or removal in Bento. Specifies the number of available desks. It is not emitted for the first-ever created default desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksSwitch
histogram.summary:
Emitted when the active desk is changed to specify the source of this action, i.e. whether due to new-desk shortcut, desk removed, window activated, switch-desk shortcut, or a press on the desk mini_view.
Note: the bucket for user switching was previousy emitted to at session startup which meant that it was artificially inflated. As of M123, these events now end up in the session restore bucket.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksSwitchScreenshotResult
histogram.summary: Emitted when a starting or ending screenshot succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.MoveWindowFromActiveDesk
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window is moved from the current active desk to another desk. Specifies the source of this action, i.e. whether to window drag-and-drop, or keyboard shortcut. As of M90, the "Assign to desk menu" bucket is emitted when a user assigns a window to all desks through its context menu. Prior to this, the "Assign to desk menu" bucket was emitted when a user switched desks and their All Desks windows were moved from the old active desk to the new active desk. As of M99, the "Assign to desk menu" no longer tracks the assign to all desks source. The replacement is "Ash.Desks.AssignToAllDesksSource".

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NewDesk2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is created to specify the source of this action, i.e. whether from the new-desk button, keyboard shortcut, or due to desks restore. It is not emitted for the first-ever created default desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfDeskTraversals
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a desk (virtual workspace) has visibly changed in a time span of five seconds. This counts the number of total traversals; for example if the user has moved from desk 1 to 2 to 1 to 2 to 3, the number recorded is 4. This only gets recorded if a traversal starts. A traversal means that the desk has changed onscreen.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsClosed2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is removed and all windows on the desk being closed to record the total number of windows being closed by this operation. Emitted only for close-all.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsClosed2.{RemovalSource}
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is removed and all windows on the desk being closed by {RemovalSource} to record the total number of windows being closed by this operation. Emitted only for close-all.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_1
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the first desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_10
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the tenth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_11
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the eleventh desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_12
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the twelfth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_13
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the thirteenth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_14
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the fourteenth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_15
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the fifteenth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_16
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the sixteenth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_2
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the second desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_3
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the third desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_4
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the fourth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_5
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the fifth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_6
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the sixth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_7
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the seventh desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_8
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the eighth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_9
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the ninth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.PresentationTime.UpdateGesture
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a four finger swipe is being used to change desks. One full swipe results in multiple emissions of this metric; once everytime the fingers change location on the trackpad. Presentation time is the time it takes from when the software recognizes the touchpad swipe to when the next frame is displayed on the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.PresentationTime.UpdateGesture.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: The largest presentation time value in ms for a single four finger swipe to change desks. One full swipe results in one emission of this metric; its the largest value of Ash.Desks.PresentationTime.UpdateGesture which is emitted multiple times during a single full swipe. Presentation time is the time it takes from when the software recognizes the touchpad swipe to when the next frame is displayed on the frame.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.RemoveDesk
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is removed to specify the source of this remove operation, i.e. whether from the close-desk button, or keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.RemoveDeskType
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is removed to specify the category of this remove operation among close all, combine desk, and close all and wait.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.WeeklyActiveDesks
histogram.summary: The number of unique weekly active desks a user has interacted with in a week. A desk is considered interacted with if a window is moved to it, it is created, its name is changed, or it is activated and stayed on for at least 3s. This metric is persisted across multiple sessions and restarts. I.e. if a user logs out and logs back in. This metric is reported a week after it begins counting. If a session is restored and more than a week has elapsed since counting has begun, the restored data will be emitted as an entry and this metric will be reset.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.{EntryPoint}.BarAction.{BarAction}
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user {BarAction} using the {EntryPoint} desk bar to specify how often users are using the {EntryPoint} desk bar to perform these actions.

variant.name: ActivateDesk
variant.summary: activates a desk (via the desk preview button)

variant.name: CloseDesk
variant.summary: closes a desk with its windows

variant.name: CombineDesks
variant.summary: combines a desk with another desk

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTamplate.LaunchAdminTemplate
histogram.summary: Emitted when an admin template is launched.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.AddOrUpdateTemplateStatus
histogram.summary: Emitted when a desk template is added or updated to indicate result of this operation. i.e. whether this operation is successful or failed with any particular reason.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.AdminTemplateTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs in an admin template when it is launched.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.AdminTemplateWindowCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows in an admin template when it is launched.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.DeleteSaveAndRecall
histogram.summary: Recorded when a Save and Recall saved desk is manually deleted.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.DeleteTemplate
histogram.summary: Recorded when desk templates are deleted, is never false.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.FloatingWorkspaceTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs in a Floating Workspace desk when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.FloatingWorkspaceWindowAndTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows and tabs in a Floating Workspace desk when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.FloatingWorkspaceWindowCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows in a Floating Workspace desk when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.LaunchFloatingWorkspace
histogram.summary: Emitted when a Floating Workspace desk is launched.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.LaunchFromTemplate
histogram.summary: Emitted when a template is launched and a desk is created, is never false.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.LaunchSaveAndRecall
histogram.summary: Emitted when a Save and Recall desk is launched.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.LoadTemplateGrid
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user opens the template grid, is never false.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.NewSaveAndRecall
histogram.summary: Recorded when a new Save and Recall desk is created.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.NewTemplate
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user creates a desk template, is never false.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.ReplaceSaveAndRecall
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user replaces a Save and Recall desk.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.ReplaceTemplate
histogram.summary: Recorded when replace dialog opens and user accepted it, is never false.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAndRecallLocalDeskSavedDeskParseError
histogram.summary: Recorded when a Save and Recall desk cannot be parsed.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAndRecallTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs in a Save and Recall desk when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAndRecallTemplateSize
histogram.summary: Records the save and recall template file size that is saved to local storage.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAndRecallUnsupportedAppDialogShow
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the unsupported Apps dialog shows. This event is triggered when a user attempts to save a Save and Recall desk that contains an unsupported app type. Currently the saved desk feature only supports PWAs, Extensions, and browser instances.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAndRecallWindowAndTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows and tabs in a Save and Recall desk when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAndRecallWindowCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows in a Save and Recall desk when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveAsTemplatePressed
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the "Save desk as template" option in the desk action context menu is pressed.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SavedDeskButtonsShown
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the desk action context menu opens and the saved desk options are shown.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SavedDeskMenuOptionsShown
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the desk action context menu opens and the saved desk options are not shown, but would have if the Saved Desk UI revamp feature was enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.SaveForLaterPressed
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the "Save desk for later" option in the desk action context menu is pressed.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.ShowSavedDeskButtonsRevampDisabled
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the saved desk buttons in the overview grid are shown.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.ShowSavedDeskButtonsRevampEnabled
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the saved desk buttons in the overview grid are viable to be shown, but don't appear, as the Saved Desk UI revamp feature is enabled. The saved desk options should apppear in the desk context menu instead.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.TabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs in a template when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.TemplateSize
histogram.summary: Records the file size of the desk template that is saved to local storage.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.TimeBetweenSaveAndRecall
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between the creation of a new Save and Recall desk and its launch (and automatic deletion).

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.TimeToLoadTemplate
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to launch a template from the time that the launch is invoked to the time that the last window is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.UnsupportedAppDialogShow
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the unsupported Apps dialog shows. This event is triggered when a user attempts to save a template that contains an unsupported app type. Currently the desks templates feature only supports PWAs, Extensions, and browser instances.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.UserSaveAndRecallCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of Save and Recall desks a user has saved when a desk is saved or deleted.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.UserTemplateCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of templates a user has saved when a template is saved or deleted.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.WindowAndTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows and tabs in a template when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.WindowCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows in a template when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.Display.InternalDisplay.ActiveEffectiveResolution
histogram.summary: The effective resolution of the internal display after device scale factor and display zoom level has been applied. This is the exact value matching the display's effective resolution. This is emitted at regular intervals.

histogram.name: Ash.Display.{DisplayType}.ActiveEffectiveDPI
histogram.summary: The effective DPI of the {DisplayType} computed from active effective resolution and display physical size. The bucket value ranges from 50 to 500 with bucket count of 90. This is emitted at regular intervals.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Action
histogram.summary: User-initiated action taken that affects docked windows such as docking, undocking, minimizing, restoring, closing or just dragging a docked window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ActionSource
histogram.summary: Source (mouse, touch, keyboard or unknown) of the user-initiated action for docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsAll
histogram.summary: Number of all docked windows or panels including hidden or minimized. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsLarge
histogram.summary: Number of large (wider than dock maximum width) windows that had to be shrunk to get docked among the visible docked windows. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsPanels
histogram.summary: Number of docked visible panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsVisible
histogram.summary: Number of visible docked windows or panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between instances of docking, undocking or any other action affecting docked state of a window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Width
histogram.summary: Width of the docked area in pixels. Recorded every time it changes after a user window resize operation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.DozeMode.RealPower.DurationPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of RealPower status duration over the total duration. Recorded daily.

histogram.name: Ash.DozeMode.{PowerStatus}.Duration
histogram.summary: The accumulated duration in ms of doze mode power scheduler has sent {PowerStatus} to arcvm. Recorded daily.

histogram.name: Ash.DragWindowFromShelf.PresentationTime
histogram.summary:
Presentation time in ms when a window is dragged from the bottom of the shelf. Recorded when the drag action is in progress.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-10-04 to 2023-02-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.DragWindowFromShelf.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time in ms when a window is dragged from the bottom of the shelf. Recorded when the drag action is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.EndOfLife.IncentiveButtonClicked
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times that each end of life incentive button has been clicked. Recorded when the button is clicked to open the incentive url.

histogram.name: Ash.EndOfLife.IncentiveShowSource
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times that each end of life incentive type is shown. Recorded as soon as the end of life incentive is shown on the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.EssentialSearch.Status
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to chromeoscompliance API. Reported once per call. Chromeoscompliance API is called every time the user signs in, unlocks the device, or stays in session for 24 hours. This event would only occur if EssentialSearchEnabled policy set.

histogram.name: Ash.EventLatency.Core.NoOverflow.TotalLatency
histogram.summary:
Similar to "Ash.EventLatency.Core.TotalLatency" that tracks total latency of 5 core events (MouseDragged/MousePressed/MouseReleased/KeyPressed/KeyReleased) for ash UI, from when the user input causing the event is generated until the frame caused by the event is submitted by the GPU service and presented successfully on the screen.
But this one does not record overflow samples. It is a temp metric before the large number samples in overflow bucket (b/290611576) is resolved.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Ash.EventLatency.Core.TotalLatency
histogram.summary:
Similar to "Ash.EventLatency.TotalLatency" but tracks total latency of 5 core events (MouseDragged/MousePressed/MouseReleased/KeyPressed/KeyReleased) for ash UI, from when the user input causing the event is generated until the frame caused by the event is submitted by the GPU service and presented successfully on the screen.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Ash.EventLatency.TotalLatency
histogram.summary:
Tracks total latency of all types of event for ash UI, from when the user input causing the event is generated until the frame caused by the event is submitted by the GPU service and presented successfully on the screen.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Ash.EventLatency.{EventType}.TotalLatency
histogram.summary:
Tracks total latency of {EventType} for ash UI, from when the user input causing the event is generated until the frame caused by the event is submitted by the GPU service and presented successfully on the screen.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Ash.EventLatency.{EventType}.TotalLatency.1MinAfterResume
histogram.summary:
Tracks total latency of {EventType} for ash UI, from when the user input causing the event is generated until the frame caused by the event is submitted by the GPU service and presented successfully on the screen.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.
This metric is only recorded for 1 minute after the device is resumed.

histogram.name: Ash.ExtendedUpdates.DialogEvent
histogram.summary: The number of times an event on the Extended Updates opt-in dialog happened. Note that a user may open and close the dialog multiple times before finally opting in, so it's more useful to filter on unique clients.

histogram.name: Ash.ExtendedUpdates.EntryPointEvent
histogram.summary: The number of times an event related to the various entry points into the Extended Updates opt-in flow happened. These numbers only include owner users on unmanaged and opt-in required devices. Note that these events can happen multiple times for the same user, so it's more useful to filter on unique clients.

histogram.name: Ash.FirstWebContentsProfile.Recorded
histogram.summary: Whether the Startup.FirstWebContents.* metrics were recorded for the first active web browser window in a ChromeOS session. Recorded once per ChromeOS session in which a browser window is restored. An example where this is false: When the post-login feature is enabled and the user has selected "Ask every time" for restoring their session, an overview mode window is active on startup rather than a browser window, so Startup.FirstWebContents metrics are skipped.

histogram.name: Ash.Float.FloatWindowCountsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of floating windows per session, which is from the time a user logs in to the time they log off. This counts how many times any window enters float state. If the same window is floated twice in the same session, it will get recorded twice.

histogram.name: Ash.Float.FloatWindowDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time a user keeps a floating window open and visible. Open and visible means the window is in float state and is on the active desk. If a window is floated and moved to an inactive desk we stop recording. The timer starts when we float a window and we record the histogram when the window is unfloated. The recording can also happen if a floated window is moved to an inactive desk, or the desk changes; we treat this as unfloated.

histogram.name: Ash.Float.FloatWindowMoveToAnotherDeskCounts
histogram.summary: The counts of how many times floated windows moved to another desk per session, which is from the time a user logs in to the time they log off.

histogram.name: Ash.Float.MultitaskMenuActionType.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whatever action is taken on the {TabletOrClamshell} multitask menu.

histogram.name: Ash.Float.MultitaskMenuEntryType.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the multitask menu is opened from {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the method used to open the menu.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.FloatingWorkspaceV1Initialized
histogram.summary: Recorded when floating workspace service is launched. The false bucket is unused here.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.FloatingWorkspaceV1RestoredSessionType
histogram.summary: Recorded the browser session type (local or remote) restored by floating workspace service on current device.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.FloatingWorkspaceV2Initialized
histogram.summary: Recorded when floating workspace service V2 is launched. The false bucket is unused here.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateLaunchFailureStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded the reason for template launch failures.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateLaunchTimeOut
histogram.summary: Recorded the reason for template launch timeouts either when we pass the threshold for waiting for a floating workspace to be downloaded or when there's no floating workspace template to be downloaded after waiting for the set timeout.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateLoadTime
histogram.summary: Indicate the time to download a floating workspace template. If after set timeout is reached and there is no floating workspace template downloaded, a record of the timeout will be recorded in "Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateLaunchTimeOut".

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateNotFound
histogram.summary: Recorded when floating workspace service V2 is initialized, but no floating workspace template was found. The false bucket is unused here.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateSize
histogram.summary: Record the size of an uploaded floating workspace template.

histogram.name: Ash.FloatingWorkspace.TemplateUploadStatus
histogram.summary: Record the floating workspace template upload status.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.Api.{Method}.Latency
histogram.summary: Recorded API latency of the requests sent by Focus Mode. The recorded value indicates the time to receive the response.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.Api.{Method}.Result
histogram.summary: Recorded API result of the requests sent by Focus Mode. The recorded value indicates whether the request succeeds with retry.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.Api.{Method}.RetryCount
histogram.summary: Recorded API result of the requests sent by Focus Mode. The recorded value indicates whether the request succeeds with retry.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.Api.{Method}.Status
