histogram.summary: Recorded API status of the requests sent by Focus Mode. The recorded enum value indicates the HTTP status code of response.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.DNDStateOnFocusEnd
histogram.summary: Records interactions with Do Not Disturb during a Focus Mode session. Recorded once per session. Indicates the final state of Do Not Disturb and if a user changed the state during the session.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.DuringSession.ToggleEndSessionSource
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a focus session will be ended through the focus panel, the contextual panel, or the feature pod.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.EndingMomentBubbleAction
histogram.summary: Record the reason for the ending moment bubble closed.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.MusicPausedSessionCount
histogram.summary: When a session ends, record how many times the user paused the playlists which were played by the Focus Mode during the session.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.PercentOfSessionCompleted.{SessionDurationType}
histogram.summary: Records the percent of the session which was completed (bucketed by the final session duration) when a session is over. This is for the {SessionDurationType} type of `Short` (< 11 mins), `Medium` (11 - 29 mins), and `Long` (> 29 mins).

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.PlaylistChosen
histogram.summary: Records the playlist which starts playing during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.PlaylistsDuringSession
histogram.summary: When a session ends, record how many playlists were played during the session.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.PlaylistTypesSelectedDuringSession
histogram.summary: Records the type of playlists played during a session when a session ends.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.SessionDuration
histogram.summary: Record the time in minutes since the session started when the session ends.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.SoundscapeLatency
histogram.summary: Records how many milliseconds the user waited for a soundscape playlist to be played from clicking on the playlist while in a focus session or starting a session to play the current selected playlist.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.StartSession.ExistingMediaPlaying
histogram.summary: Emits true when an existing media session is playing on the system on session start; otherwise, emits false.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.StartSession.InitialDuration
histogram.summary: Records a session duration in minutes when starting a focus session.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.StartSession.TaskState
histogram.summary: Record the state of the selected task when a focus mode session is started.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.StartSession.ToggleSource
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a focus session will be started through the focus panel or the feature pod.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.TasksCompleted
histogram.summary: When a session ends, record how many tasks were marked as completed by the user during the session.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.TasksSelected
histogram.summary: Record the count of tasks selected throughout each focus session. Emitted when a session ends. Note that only one task can be selected at a time.

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.TimeAdded.{TimeAddedType}
histogram.summary: Records the number of minutes that were added to a session (bucketed by the initial session duration) when a session is over. This is for the {TimeAddedType} type of `Short` (< 11 mins), `Medium` (11 - 29 mins), and `Long` (> 29 mins).

histogram.name: Ash.FocusMode.YouTubeMusicLatency
histogram.summary: Records how many milliseconds the user waited for a YouTube Music playlist to be played from clicking on the playlist while in a focus session or starting a session to play the current selected playlist.

histogram.name: Ash.Frame.ColorChangeCount.{AppType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of frame color changes when a {AppType} is launched. The data is collected once per app launching.

histogram.name: Ash.FullRestore.Browser.FirstInputDelay
histogram.summary: This is the same latency as PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay4 except it's recorded once per user session for the active browser window's foreground tab in a session restore (either a full ChromeOS-level session restore or a Chrome-specific restore). If a browser window that's not from a full session restore is active (ex: user opened manually), this metric is skipped.

histogram.name: Ash.FullRestore.ShowFullRestoreNotification
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the full restore notification shows up.

histogram.name: Ash.FullRestore.ShowInformedRestoreDialog
histogram.summary: Emmited every time the informed restore dialog shows up.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ControlsFeatureToggleState
histogram.summary: Records whether the game controls feature is toggled on or off.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ControlsHintToggleSource.{OnOrOff}
histogram.summary: Records where the game controls hint is toggled {OnOrOff}.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.EditControlsWithEmptyState
histogram.summary: Records whether Game Controls is in the empty state when users start to edit the Game Controls.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.FunctionTriggered
histogram.summary: Records how often a specific function within the game dashboard is triggered.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.RecordingStartSource
histogram.summary: Records where the recording starts from, main menu or toolbar.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ScreenshotTakeSource
histogram.summary: Records where the screenshot is taken from, main menu or toolbar.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ToggleMainMenu.{OnOrOff}
histogram.summary: Records the ways of the game dashboard main menu is toggled {OnOrOff}.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ToolbarClickToExpandState
histogram.summary: Records whether the tool bar is toggled to expanded or collapsed.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ToolbarNewLocation
histogram.summary: Records where the toolbar is repositioned.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.ToolbarToggleState
histogram.summary: Records whether the tool bar is toggled on or off.

histogram.name: Ash.GameDashboard.WelcomeDialogNotificationToggleState
histogram.summary: Records whether the welcome notification is toggled on or off.

histogram.name: Ash.GeminiApp.Page.Visit
histogram.summary: Records visits to Gemini app related pages. Emitted when the browser tab performing the visit has started navigation to the recorded page.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Classroom.CourseWorkItemsPerStudentCourseCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API. The recorded value indicates the number of course work items fetched for a course, where the current user is enrolled as a student.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Classroom.IsStudentRoleActiveResult
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API. The recorded value indicates whether the current user is enrolled in at least one classroom course.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Classroom.StudentCoursesCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API. The recorded value indicates the total number of active courses returned for the user. This number serves as a multiplier for futher requests to get course work items and student submissions.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Classroom.StudentDataFetchTime
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API. The recorded value indicates the time needed to fetch all student data (courses, course work, student submissions).

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Classroom.StudentSubmissionsPerStudentCourseCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API. The recorded value indicates the number of student submissions fetched for a course, where the current user is enrolled as a student.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Tasks.ProcessedTasksCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Tasks API. The recorded value indicates the number of tasks in a task list after processing (only not completed root tasks).

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Tasks.RawTasksCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Tasks API. The recorded value indicates the number of fetched raw tasks in a task list. Raw - means all individual tasks before processing, including all subtasks, since the API returns them as a flat array.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Tasks.SimultaneousMarkAsCompletedRequestsCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI submits changes to Google Tasks API after closing the bubble. The recorded value indicates the number of completed tasks that require individiual requests to update their status.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.Tasks.TaskListsCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Tasks API. The recorded value indicates the number of task lists fetched for the current user.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.{Method}.Latency
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API or Tasks API. The recorded value indicates the duration of the fetch request/response.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.{Method}.PagesCount
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API or Tasks API. The recorded value indicates the total number of pages needed to fetch in order to get all data.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Api.{Method}.Status
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever glanceables UI fetches data from Google Classroom API or Tasks API. The recorded enum value indicates the HTTP status code of the fetch response.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Classroom.Student.AssignmentListShownTime.{OccurrenceType}.{AssignmentListType}
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user had the student assignment list selected and shown. This metric is split between the default list which is shown when the bubble is first opened and assignment lists which are shown after chaning the selection. The time is measured from the moment that the list is shown to the moment that either the selection is changed or the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Classroom.Student.ListSelected
histogram.summary: The number of times that the assignment list has been selected. Recorded every time a new assignment list is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.Classroom.Student.SelectedListChangeCount
histogram.summary: The total number of times that a new student assignment list is selected. The total count is recorded when the glanceable bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.AddTaskButtonUsageForNewTasksUsersTT
histogram.summary: Records true if a new Tasks user has interacted (pressed) the "Add new task" button, false otherwise. "New Tasks users" means the user has only one tasks list with zero tasks in it. Applies only for the Trusted Testers UI. May be recorded multiple times per user.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Classroom.UserAction
histogram.summary: User actions performed in the Time Management Glanceables bubble for Google Classroom

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.FeatureStatus
histogram.summary: Whether time management glanceables are enabled, and the reason they are enabled. Recorded when the feature state gets evaluated - either when an eligible user profile gets created, or glanceables policy changes.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.LoginToShowTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent between login and opening the glanceables time management bubble. The time is measured from the moment the user logs in and the time the glanceables bubble is created.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.AddedTasks.{Emptiness}
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the user created a task in the in-line task creation UI while a task list was selected in the tasks time management glanceable bubble. The histogram is recorded when the time management glanceables bubble gets closed, or the user changes the selected task list. The count of added tasks is reset at the same time. The histogram is recorded separately depending on whether the selected task list was initially empty.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.AddedTasksForFirstUsage
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the user created a task in the in-line task creation UI while a task list was selected in the tasks time management glanceable bubble. The histogram is recorded only if the user is considered a potentially new tasks user (they have a single empty task list in Google Tasks). It's recorded when the glanceables bubble gets closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.AddTaskResult
histogram.summary: The result of use interaction with the tasks glanceables UI to add a new task. When the user clicks "Add new task" button, the tasks glanceables UI displays a textfield to enter a new task title. This metric records whether the user entered the task title, initiating an API call to create a task, or whether they dismissed it while it was empty.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.ChildResizing.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: The animation smoothness of the resize animation of the glanceables tasks bubble view. This occurs when a task is entering edit mode or an editted task is committed.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.ModifyTaskResult
histogram.summary: The result of use interaction with the tasks glanceables UI to modify a task. When the user clicks on a task title, the tasks glanceables UI displays a textfield that lets the user update the task title. This metric records whether the user changed the task title, initiating an API call to modify the task, or whether they dismissed it with no changes.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.TasksListChangeCount
histogram.summary: Records the total number of times the selected tasks list is changed. The total count is recorded when the glanceable bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.Tasks.UserAction
histogram.summary: User actions performed in the Time Management Glanceables bubble for Google Tasks

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.TasksCountInDefaultTaskList
histogram.summary: Records the total number of tasks shown in the default (initially selected) task list.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.{GlanceableBubble}.ChangeListToLoadTime.{Status}
histogram.summary: The amount of time in ms that the glanceables bubble takes to load up the data from the API after the user triggered an update. Split by bubble type and query status.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.{GlanceableBubble}.OpenToInitialLoadTime.{Occurrence}
histogram.summary: The amount of time in ms that the glanceables bubble takes to load up the initial data from the API after opened. Split by bubble type and whether the time represent the first time the bubble was opened in the session or not.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement.{GlanceableBubble}.{ExpandState}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: The animation smoothness of the expand/collapse animation of the glanceables bubble. This occurs when the expand state changes which is usually triggered by clicking the expand button on the glanceables bubble view.

histogram.name: Ash.Glanceables.TimeManagement{GlanceableBubble}.TotalShowTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user kept the glanceables time management bubble open. The time is measured from the moment the glanceables bubble is created until said bubble is destroyed. Recorded when {GlanceableBubble} glanceables bubble is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Homescreen.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when performing tablet mode homescreen animations, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatGesture
histogram.summary: Gestures supported by the in-app hotseat.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatTransition.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the ShelfWidget's animating background during transitions of the hotseat to shown, extended, and hidden hotseat states. Check Ash.HotseatWidgetAnimation.AnimationSmoothness for smoothness of the HotseatWidget. {HotseatTransitionType} Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-09-06 to 2025-02-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatTransition.Drag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms of the hotseat when it changes between the hidden and the extended state as a result of a drag action. Recorded when the drag action is in progress.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatTransition.Drag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time in ms of the hotseat when it changes between the hidden and the extended state as a result of a drag action. Recorded when the drag action is finished. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-10-25 to 2025-02-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatWidgetAnimation.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the bounds animation of the hotseat widget's elements during transitions of the hotseat to shown, extended, and hidden hotseat states. Check Ash.HotseatTransition.AnimationSmoothness for smoothness of the shelf's animating background. {HotseatTransitionType}

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatWidgetAnimation.{HotseatWidgetElement}AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the bounds animation of the hotseat widget's elements during transitions of the hotseat to shown, extended, and hidden hotseat states. Check Ash.HotseatTransition.AnimationSmoothness for smoothness of the shelf's animating background. {HotseatWidgetElement}

histogram.name: Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.Lacros.TimeToPresent
histogram.summary: Similar to Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.TimeToPresent but tracks the resize latency for lacros windows by measuring configure -> ack -> present time.

histogram.name: Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.Lacros.TimeToPresent.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum time of Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.Lacros.TimeToPresent during an interactive resize.

histogram.name: Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.TimeToPresent
histogram.summary: Time between when the size of a window changes during an interactive window resize and the results are drawn (presented) on screen. This is recorded for each movement of the mouse/pointer that results in a resize.

histogram.name: Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.TimeToPresent.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum time between when the size of a window changes during an interactive window resize and the results are drawn (presented) on screen. This is recorded for each movement of the mouse/pointer that results in a resize.

histogram.name: Ash.KcerPkcs12Migration.Events
histogram.summary: Tracks events related the migration of PKCS#12 certs from the NSS public slot into the private slot provided by Chaps.

histogram.name: Ash.KcerRollbackHelper.Events
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to the rollback of double written keys and users certificates from the software backed Chaps storage to the NSS DB.

histogram.name: Ash.Lacros.Launch.Mode
histogram.summary: The Lacros operation mode. This will record whether Lacros is the only browser. It will be emitted once when the system (Ash) starts.

histogram.name: Ash.Lacros.Launch.Mode.Daily
histogram.summary: The Lacros operation mode. This will record whether Lacros is the only browser. It will be emitted at least once a day.

histogram.name: Ash.Lacros.Launch.ModeAndSource
histogram.summary: The Lacros operation mode and the origin of the setting. This will record whether Lacros is enabled as well as whether that was set by the user, enforced by a policy or enforced by the user (overriding any given policy). It will be emitted shortly before Lacros gets started the first time from the system (Ash).

histogram.name: Ash.Lacros.Launch.ModeAndSource.Daily
histogram.summary: The Lacros operation mode and the origin of the setting. This will record whether Lacros is enabled as well as whether that was set by the user, enforced by a policy or enforced by the user (overriding any given policy). It will be emitted at least once a day.

histogram.name: Ash.Lobster.State
histogram.summary:
The histogram captures user interactions with Lobster feature, providing a funnel view from the beginning to end of the user journey.
This metric is recorded at different times, depending on the event being recorded. For example, consent screen impression event is recorded at the time when the consent screen is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.ArcUiAvailableAfterLogin.Duration
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and ARC boot completion..

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Switched

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Used.ClamShellMode

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Used.TabletMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.SessionStateChange
histogram.summary: Records all session lock and unlock events.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.UserClicks
histogram.summary: The numbers of times that users click on the shelf buttons, trays and lock screen note on the ChromeOS lock screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.LoggedInStateChanged
histogram.summary: Time from the OnAuthSuccess Chrome OS cryptohome login event and LoggedInStateChanged event.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Switched
histogram.summary:
The count of auth method switching actions on ChromeOS login screen.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-01-14 to 2024-04-24; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Used.ClamShellMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in clamshell mode and on other form-factors.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Used.TabletMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.MigrationBanner
histogram.summary:
Whether the cryptohome migration banner was shown on the Chrome OS login screen.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-02-04 to 2024-04-24; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.UserClicks
histogram.summary: The numbers of times that users click on the shelf buttons and trays on the ChromeOS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.OOBE.UserClicks
histogram.summary: What shelf buttons or trays are clicked in the OOBE.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.PinAutosubmit.Backfill
histogram.summary: The result of the PIN auto submit 'Backfill' operation. Users updating to M86 with an existing PIN will have their preference regarding auto submit 'backfilled' to either enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.ShowGaiaSignin.PermanentlyUntrusted
histogram.summary: Records instances of a "PERMANENTLY_UNTRUSTED" result during the check for trusted values before showing gaia signin. This is a fatal result which will result in signin not being shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.ShowGaiaSignin.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent waiting for trusted values before showing gaia signin. Waiting for trusted values ensures that the device owner id is present before showing the signin, which is necessary for checking signin permissions for child users. This check may introduce a delay for all users. This metric allows monitoring that delay.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.TotalFirstSessionDuration
histogram.summary: Total user first session time between when the user was added to the device and session exit or device shutdown. Reported for primary users only.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.TotalSessionDuration
histogram.summary: Total user session time between sign-in and session exit or device shutdown. Reported for primary users only. First sessions are excluded and reported in a separate histogram: Ash.Login.TotalFirstSessionDuration.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Duration2.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Jank
histogram.summary: Jank metrics of all animations applied during the login process. This represents how often the frame update rate changed during animation.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the login process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.AutoRestore.AllBrowserWindowsCreated
histogram.summary:
Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and creation of all expected restored browser windows.
This metric is reported only if session is restored automatically.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.AutoRestore.AllBrowserWindowsPresented
histogram.summary:
The duration of how long it took for all pixels of expected restored windows to be rendered after primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount).
This metric is reported only if session is restored automatically.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.AutoRestore.AllBrowserWindowsShown
histogram.summary:
Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and the full manifestation of all expected restored browser windows.
This metric is reported only if session restore is automatic.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.ManualRestore.{UIFlow}.TotalDuration
histogram.summary:
Time from the moment sign in authentication is started until the post login animation finishes. (Chrome OS).
Different UI flows can have longer expected times due to extra compositor animations. For this flow, {UIFlow}.

variant.name: GlanceablesHidden
variant.summary: the post login UI is shown and animated, but the glanceables bar is hidden due to user pref

variant.name: GlanceablesShown
variant.summary: the post login UI is shown and animated, and the glanceables bar is shown. There is a loading animation on the bar that may take up to 3s

variant.name: NoLoginUI
variant.summary: no post login UI is shown. The user has full restore turned set to always or never, or there were no windows from the previous session

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.AllShelfIconsLoaded
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and the complete loading of all pinned button icons for restored windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.ArcUiAvailableAfterLogin
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and ARC boot completion..

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.PostLoginAnimation.Duration.{TabletOrClamshellMode}
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.PostLoginAnimation.Jank.{TabletOrClamshellMode}
histogram.summary: Jank metrics of all animations applied during the login process. This represents how often the frame update rate changed during animation.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.PostLoginAnimation.Smoothness.{TabletOrClamshellMode}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the login process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.ShelfLoginAnimationEnd
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to load all the shelf icons of restored windows after primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount).

histogram.name: Ash.LoginPerf.{RestoreMode}.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Time between when sign-in authentication is started and when post login animation finishes. This metric corresponds to BootTime.Login2.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllBrowserWindowsCreated
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and creation of all expected restored browser windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllBrowserWindowsPresented
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took for all pixels of expected restored windows to be rendered after primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount).

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllBrowserWindowsShown
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and the full manifestation of all expected restored browser windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllShelfIconsLoaded
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and the complete loading of all pinned button icons for restored windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.ShelfLoginAnimationEnd
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to load all the shelf icons of restored windows after primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount).

histogram.name: Ash.MagicBoost.DisclaimerView.{OptInFeatures}
histogram.summary: Tracks the actions in the magic boost disclaimer view, which is triggered by the {OptInFeatures}. Recorded when the magic boost disclaimer view is shown or any button in the view is clicked.

variant.name: Total
variant.summary: no filter is added, records the total number

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.ButtonClicked
histogram.summary: Recorded when any button in the web Mahi Penel widget is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.Elucidation.LoadingTime
histogram.summary: Record the time it takes to load the elucidation inside the Mahi panel. Emitted when elucidation text is fully loaded and shows up.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.Feedback
histogram.summary: Record the type of feedback that a user has for the Mahi feature. Emitted when users click the thumbs up or thumbs down button in the panel.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.QuestionAnswer.LoadingTime
histogram.summary: Record the time it takes to answer the question inside the Mahi panel. Emitted when an answer text is fully loaded and shows up.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.QuestionCountPerMahiSession
histogram.summary: Record the count of questions in each Mahi session. Emitted when a Mahi session ends, including: 1. Content is refreshed. 2. Mahi UI is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.QuestionSource
histogram.summary: Record the sources of questions sent to the Mahi backend. Emitted when a question is posted.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.Summary.LoadingTime
histogram.summary: Record the time it takes to load the summary inside the Mahi panel. Emitted when summary text is fully loaded and shows up.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.TimesPanelOpenedPerSession
histogram.summary: Records the times the Mahi panel was opened in a session. The metric is emitted once per session when the session is no longer active, either through a session state change or on shutdown.

histogram.name: Ash.Mahi.UserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: Records time user spent in Mahi Panel. Starts measuring time whenever the MahiPanelView is constructed, and records metric when the view is destroyed.

histogram.name: Ash.MantaService.{MantaMetricType}.StatusCode
histogram.summary: Record the status code of {MantaMetricType} requests.

histogram.name: Ash.MantaService.{MantaMetricType}.TimeCost
histogram.summary: Record the time cost of successful {MantaMetricType} requests.

histogram.name: Ash.Media.CameraPrivacySwitch.Event
histogram.summary: Reports events related to camera privacy switch state. The camera privacy switch is a hardware toggle supported by some Chrome OS devices that disables the built in camera video feed. The histogram is reported (1) when a camera privacy switch state change is detected (which generally causes a system toast to get shown), and (2) when a notification informing the user that the camera privacy switch is on (the notification is shown if the user tries to use their camera with the privacy switch tuned on). The camera privacy switch state is only recorded if the state change is a result of a user action - it will not be recorded for state changes that are a result of camera privacy switch state initialization.

histogram.name: Ash.Media.CameraPrivacySwitch.TimeFromNotificationToOff
histogram.summary: Time from showing a notification informing the user about the camera privacy switch to the user turning the privacy switch off. The camera privacy switch is a hardware switch supported by some Chrome OS devices that cuts the video camera feed off. The Chrome OS UI shows a notification if the user tries to use the camera with the privacy switch on. The intention is to track the time it takes for the user to flip the privacy switch after they're notified the camera is disabled. The histogram is recorded if the user toggles the camera privacy switch after seeing the notification about the privacy switch being on (if the switch is toggled more than once after the notification gets shown, only the first toggle action will be reported). The time is reported in seconds with 5 second granularity.

histogram.name: Ash.MessageCenter.Scroll.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while scrolling through the list of notifications in Notification Center. Emitted when Notification Center is scrolled.

histogram.name: Ash.MessageCenter.Scroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Presentation time while scrolling through the list of notifications in Notification Center. Emitted when Notification Center is scrolled.

histogram.name: Ash.MojoServiceManager.BootstrapRetryTimes
histogram.summary: The retry times when try to bootstrap to mojo service manager.

histogram.name: Ash.MojoServiceManager.IsConnectionLost
histogram.summary: Whether the connection to mojo service manager is lost before during ash running.

histogram.name: Ash.MultiDisplay.WindowsMovedAfterRemap.DisplayRotated
histogram.summary: After a display rotation, the existing app windows will get remapped. A one minute timer then runs. If any of the app windows are moved or resized by the user, then this histogram records true. If the timer ends without an app window being moved or resized, then this histogram records false. Used to determine if the user is satisfied with the window manager auto remap.

histogram.name: Ash.MultiDisplay.WindowsMovedAfterRemap.DisplayWorkAreaChanged
histogram.summary: After a display work area change, the existing app windows will get remapped. A one minute timer then runs. If any of the app windows are moved or resized by the user, then this histogram records true. If the timer ends without an app window being moved or resized, then this histogram records false. Used to determine if the user is satisfied with the window manager auto remap.

histogram.name: Ash.NavigationWidget.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the navigation widget's elements, which are the widget itself and its child views. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. Recorded every time an animation is triggered in the Navigation Widget. We record this metric for each element separately. {HotseatTransitionType}

histogram.name: Ash.NavigationWidget.{NavigationWidgetElement}AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the navigation widget's elements, which are the widget itself and its child views. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. Recorded every time an animation is triggered in the Navigation Widget. We record this metric for each element separately. {NavigationWidgetElement}

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.AutoNightLightNotificationShown
histogram.summary: Emitted when the Auto Night Light notification is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.AutoNightLightNotificationState
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user interacts with the Auto Night Light notification to report the state of the notification as a result of this interaction.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.DisplayCrtcCtmSupport
histogram.summary: The type of CRTC color transorm matrix support for the currently connected displays. Emitted when cursor compositing status is refreshed, but only when Night Light is on. The cursor compositing status is refreshed whenever there is a change in Night Light status or color temperature.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.ScheduleType
histogram.summary: The selected Night Light schedule type. Emitted when the user changes the Night Light schedule type from the Display System Settings.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.ScheduleType.Initial
histogram.summary: The selected Night Light schedule type. Emitted on login.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.Temperature
histogram.summary: The ranges in which the selected values of the Night Light color temperature reside. Emitted when the user drags the Night Light color temperature slider to change its value from the Display System Settings.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.Temperature.Initial
histogram.summary: The current Night Light color temperature. Low temperatures are cooler, higher temperature are warmer. Emitted on login.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ClearAllStacked.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "clear all" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the clear all button is pressed with notifications that are not visible on screen. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ClearAllVisible.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "clear all" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the clear all button is pressed and all notifications are visible. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.CountOfNotificationsInOneGroup
histogram.summary: The number of notification contained in one group. Emitted when a notification is added or removed from a group.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ExpandOrCollapse.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "Expand or Collapse" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the notification requests a size change due to being expanded or collapsed. Usually involves other layer animations which are named (get name from leandre@).

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.GroupNotification.SlideOut.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the slide out part of the animation when a grouped notification is removed. Emmitted when a grouped notification is removed by clicking on it's close button.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.GroupNotificationAdded
histogram.summary: Record the types of group notification added to the system. The types are group parent and group child. Emitted when a group notification is created.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ImageMemorySizeInKB
histogram.summary: Record the memory size in KB of notification images on the 1.0 scale factor. Emitted when setting a notification's image.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.MoveDown.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "move down" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when a notification is removed and notifications above the deleted one animate downwards to fill in the space. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.RemovedByLimitEnforcement
histogram.summary: Recorded when a notification is removed due to the number of notifications reaching the limit.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.SmallImageMemorySizeInKB
histogram.summary: Record the memory size in KB of notification small images on the 1.0 scale factor. Emitted when setting a notification's small image.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.SwipeControl.FadeIn.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of the settings button inside a swipe control notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of notification pop-up. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when pop-up animations are completed, including pop-up fade-in, fade-out, move-up, move-down.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.OnTopOfSurfacesPopupCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of popups that show up on top of a UI surface. Emitted when the UI surface is shown or changes height when popup notifications are visible, and when there's a new notification popup added when the UI surface is visible.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.OnTopOfSurfacesType
histogram.summary: Records the type of UI surface that popup notifications are shown on top of. Emitted when the UI surface is shown or changes height when popup notifications are visible, and when there's a new notification popup added when the UI surface is visible.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationResource.ActionIconSizeInKB
histogram.summary: Record the memory size in KB of notification source action icons on the 1.0 scale factor. Emitted when applying an action icon to a notification built from a notification resource.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationResource.BadgeMemorySizeInKB
histogram.summary: Record the memory size in KB of notification source badges on the 1.0 scale factor. Emitted when applying a badge to a notification built from a notification resource.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationResource.IconMemorySizeInKB
histogram.summary: Record the memory size in KB of notification source icons on the 1.0 scale factor. Emitted when applying an icon to a notification built from a notification resource.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationResource.ImageMemorySizeInKB
histogram.summary: Record the memory size in KB of notification source images on the 1.0 scale factor. Emitted when applying an image to a notification built from a notification resource.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ConvertSingleToGroup.{Animation}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the {Animation} in notification view when converting from single to group notification. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ExpandButton.BoundsChange.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounds change animation of the expand button inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ExpandButton.ClickAction
histogram.summary: The count of actions that is performed after an expand button is clicked. The actions are expanding or collapsing individual or group notification. Emitted when an expand button is clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ExpandButton.ConvertSingleToGroup.{Animation}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the {Animation} inside the expand button of the notification view when converting from single to group notification. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ImageContainerView.ScaleDown.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the scale down animation of image container view inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the scale down animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ImageDrag.EndState
histogram.summary: Records the notification drag end state when the notification image drag ends.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ImageDrag.Start
histogram.summary: Records the notification catalog name when the notification image drag starts.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.NotificationAdded.Type
histogram.summary: Records the types of notification view added to the system. Emitted when each notification is added and the notification is visible.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.{ChildView}.FadeIn.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of {ChildView} inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.{ChildView}.FadeOut.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade out animation of {ChildView} inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade out animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.{ChildView}.ScaleAndTranslate.AnimationSmoothness
Ash.NotifierFramework.Nudge.ShownCount

Starts measuring time when the nudge is shown and records the Nudge catalog name in one of the `TimeRange` buckets if the user performs the nudge's suggested action. These buckets are all exclusive.

histogram.summary: Records the nudge catalog name when a user presses one of the nudge's buttons.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.PinnedSystemNotification.ShownWithoutIcon
histogram.summary: Records a `catalog_name` whenever a pinned notification is shown without having provided a `vector_small_image` through its `Notification` object. All pinned notifications must have an icon, so the metric will be used to track misbehaving notifications.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.PinnedSystemNotification.ShownWithoutTitle
histogram.summary: Records a `catalog_name` whenever a pinned notification is shown without having provided a `title` through its `Notification` object. All pinned notifications must have a title, so the metric will be used to track misbehaving notifications.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Toast.Dismissed.{TimeRange}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time a specific toast spends on screen before being dismissed by the user or system. Records the toast catalog name in one of the time buckets available when toast is dismissed either manually or by time out.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Toast.ShownCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific toast is shown to users. This metric is recorded every time a toast is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Toast.TimeInQueue
histogram.summary: Records the time a toast spends in queue before it's shown on screen.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Added
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific system notification is added to the notification list. This metric is recorded every time the `OnNotificationAdded` event is triggered for a system notification.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.ClickedActionButton.{ButtonIndex}
histogram.summary: Tracks action button presses on system notifications. Records the notification catalog name in one of the button index buckets.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Popup.Dismissed.{TimeRange}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time a specific system notification spends as a pop-up before being dismissed either by the user or system. Records the notification catalog name in one of the time buckets available when the pop-up is dismissed either manually or by time out.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Popup.ShownCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific system notification pop-up is shown to users.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Popup.UserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: Records the time a system notification spends as a pop-up before being dismissed either by the user or system. Starts measuring time whenever the pop-up is shown to the user, and records metric when the pop-up is dismissed either manually or by time out.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.Login.AuthFactorMigrationResult.{AuthFactorMigrationName}
histogram.summary: The result of {AuthFactorMigrationName} migration. Reported on each login after the migrations are run.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.Login.ConfiguredAuthFactors.{AuthFactor}
histogram.summary: Whether the logged in user has {AuthFactor} auth factor configured. Recorded upon successful login.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.Login.Times.{LoginStage}
histogram.summary: Time spent during particular stages of login process. Recorded upon successful login.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.Passwordless
histogram.summary: Whether the logged-in user does not have a password. Recorded upon successful login.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.{AuthenticationSurface}.NbPasswordAttempts.{AuthenticationOutcome}
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect passwords entered in Chrome OS {AuthenticationSurface} screen until the "{AuthenticationOutcome}" outcome. For previous data (grouped for login and lock screen together) see "Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.*".

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Close
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when closing a window, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Enter{OverviewAnimationMode}
Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Exit{OverviewAnimationMode}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting overview mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. {OverviewAnimationMode}. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-02-07 to 2024-07-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.ArrowKeyPresses
histogram.summary: The number of times the arrow keys are pressed in overview mode per session, i.e. between bringing up overview mode and ending it. This is only measured for the sessions that end by selecting a window with the enter key.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.DelayedDeskBar.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the enter-overview animation has finished/the desk bar is opened to when the next frame is shown to the user. Note this metric is only recorded in cases where the desk bar is opened after the enter-overview animation completes; it's not recorded in overview sessions where the desk bar opens immediately at the beginning of the session. In the latter case, the time to open the desk bar is incorporated into Ash.Overview.Enter.PresentationTime.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.DeskBarInitLatency
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time it takes to initialize the desk bar widget when entering overview mode. Recorded each time overview mode is entered.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.DeskBarNumLayersMirrored
histogram.summary: Records the number of ui/compositor layers that were mirrored when rendering the desk bar as part of overview mode. More specifically, these are the layers mirrored to create the "mini views" of each desk within the desk bar. Recorded once per overview mode session in which the desk bar was present; if the mirrored layers are rebuilt after the first rendering, this is not counted. Not recorded for overview mode sessions without the desk bar.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.DeskBarVisibility
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the desk bar was opened during an overview mode session, and if so, when it was opened (within or after the first frame). Recorded once per overview session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.DeskCount
histogram.summary: The number of desks open when entering overview mode. Recorded each time overview mode is entered. This does not take into account the user creating new desks while in overview mode afterwards.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.EndAction
histogram.summary:
Emitted when exiting overview mode. Recording the reasons for ending overview mode. E.g, pressing the overview button at status area.
Note: M130 has a fix. When exiting overview mode for the "informed restore" dialog after login (prompting the user whether they want to restore windows from the previous session), this was being logged as "Pressing shortcut F5". This has been fixed to be logged under ""After user login, close dialog ...".

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Enter.PresentationTime.WithDeskBarAndNumWindows{NumWindows}
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview enter event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user. Recorded once per overview session in which a) there are {NumWindows} windows open across all desks b) the desk bar is rendered immediately in the very first overview mode frame c) the desk bar contains previews of each desk's contents. All other overview sessions that do not meet these criteria are not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Enter.PresentationTime2
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview enter event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Enter.PresentationTime2.{OverviewStartReason}
histogram.summary:
Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview enter event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.
This is the exact same measurement as Ash.Overview.Enter.PresentationTime, but segmented by different reasons overview mode was started, which have different profile and performance characteristics.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Exit.PresentationTime.WithDeskBarAndNumWindows{NumWindows}
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview exit event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user. Recorded once per overview session in which a) there are {NumWindows} windows open across all desks b) the desk bar was rendered at some point during the overview session c) the desk bar contains previews of each desk's contents. All other overview sessions that do not meet these criteria are not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Exit.PresentationTime2
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview exit event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Items
histogram.summary: The number of items (single windows or groups of windows such as panels) in the overview mode, present at the start of each session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.KeyPressesOverItemsRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio between the arrow key presses and the number of overview items, expressed as a percentage for a single session. Recorded when an overview session is exited after selecting a highlighted overview item.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.OverviewClosedItems
histogram.summary: The number of items closed from the window overview for a single session. Recorded when exiting an overview session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Scroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time for scrolling the overview grid in overview mode for a scrolling session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Scroll.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time for scrolling the overview grid in overview mode. Each time the grid is updated by a scroll, the time it takes to update the new visuals onto the screen is updated.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected in overview mode, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.StartAction
histogram.summary:
Emitted when entering overview mode. Recording the reasons for starting overview mode. E.g, pressing the overview button at status area.
Note: M130 has a fix. When overview mode was started for the "informed restore" dialog after login (prompting the user whether they want to restore windows from the previous session), this was being logged as "Pressing shortcut F5". This has been fixed to be logged under ""After user login, if full restore...".

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges
histogram.summary: The amount of time between endings of overview mode sessions which were caused by the user selecting a window which was not previously active. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user selected a window which was not previously active.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: The amount of time between uses of overview mode, recorded when overview mode is entered. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user entered overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeInOverview
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode. Overview mode is engaged by pressing the overview accelerator, overview button tray or swiping up from the shelf in tablet mode. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled. Recorded when an overview session is exited, before the exit animation starts.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time for dragging a window in overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time for dragging a window in overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.Workflow
histogram.summary: Recorded when a drag from overview (not from the top or shelf) is completed, and when an overview item is closed by vertically swiping or flinging (even if you fling without dragging).

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowOcclusionCalculator.EnterLatency
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time window occlusion calculations take when entering overview mode. The window occlusion calculations are used to optimize the desk bar that appears as part of overview mode. Recorded every time overview mode is opened and the DeskBarWindowOcclusionOptimizationEnabled experiment flag is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowOcclusionCalculator.ExitLatency
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time window occlusion calculations take when exiting overview mode. The window occlusion calculations are used to optimize the desk bar that appears as part of overview mode. Recorded every time overview mode is closed and the DeskBarWindowOcclusionOptimizationEnabled experiment flag is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.Peripheral.ConnectivityResults
histogram.summary:
The connectivity results of when the user plugs in a Thunderbolt/USB4 peripheral to their Chrome OS device. This is recorded for only devices that support Thunderbolt/USB4 connectivity. Gets recorded every time a Thunderbolt/USB4 peripheral is plugged in. This histogram is based off of the obsolete Ash.PciePeripheral.ConnectivityResults histogram and also includes invalid cable detection from the Chrome OS type-c daemon.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-12-31 to 2023-08-21; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnDisplayAdded
histogram.summary: The number of windows restored in multi-display scenario, such as due to disconnecting and reconnecting display, enabling and disabling mirror mode, entering and leaving dock mode. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnScreenRotation
histogram.summary: Emits the number of windows bounds restored when rotating the screen back to the previous screen orientation. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Ambient.GooglePhotosPreviewsLoadTime
histogram.summary: Emitted when a request to load ambient mode google photos albums preview images completes, but only upon first page load. This roughly corresponds to user perceived time it takes to load the ambient preview section of Personalization App. Does not emit if a user opens Personalization App onto a page that does not load google photos albums previews. Does not emit unless the user already has ambient mode enabled and Google Photos selected as the source upon first opening Personalization App.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Ambient.LinkToGooglePhotosClicked
histogram.summary: Emitted whenever the user clicks the hyperlink to config Google Photos from the ambient UI albums selection subpage.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.AlbumsPath
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user navigates to the ambient mode albums selection page in the Personalization Hub. Record the type of albums the user visits.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.AnimationTheme2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects an animation theme in screensaver subpage or when screensaver is first enabled. In the latter case, the theme is recorded here even without the user explicitly selecting it in the screensaver subpage. The theme in this case will either be the default chosen by the system, or the theme that the user had selected when they last disabled screensaver.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.OptIn
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user presses the `Turn on` button on ambient preview to enable screen saver.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.ScreenSaverDuration
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects a new screen saver duration option.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.Video2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects the video theme, selects a new video in the screensaver subpage, or enables screensaver with a video theme automatically active. The latter can happen if a video theme is the default on that particular device model, or if the user had selected a video theme in the past when they last disabled screensaver.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.App.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a user spends in the Personalization App on each visit.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.ColorScheme.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the color scheme that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.ColorSchemeButton
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user clicks a button to choose a color scheme for dynamic color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.StaticColor.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the static color that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.StaticColorButton
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user clicks a static color button for dynamic color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.ToggleButton
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user clicks the toggle button to enable or disable dynamic color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: Records which entry point is used to access Personalization Hub. Emitted every time Personalization hub is accessed.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.Color
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects a keyboard backlight color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.Color.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the keyboard backlight color that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.DisplayType.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the display type of keyboard backlight color that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.OpenZoneCustomization
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the user selects 'Customize' button to open zone customization dialog to view or set zone colors, even when no zone color changed.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.WallpaperColor.Valid2
histogram.summary: Emitted when the wallpaper extracted color is available and the keyboard backlight selection is updated to be wallpaper color. Only non transparent colors are considered valid.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.ZoneColors.Zone{ZoneIdx}.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the keyboard backlight color for zone {ZoneIdx} that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload if the user currently uses customized zone colors for keyboard backlight.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Path
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user navigates to a valid path in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Theme.ColorMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects a theme button in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.PhantomWindowController.Show.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when show phantom window was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user. The phantom window is shown to give users an indication of the window bounds of the next state. For example, when dragging a window to the left side of the display, the phantom window will take up roughly the left half of the work area to indicate the bounds of the window, if the drag is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.Search.{Provider}Provider.QueryTime
histogram.summary: The delay from when a search request was sent to the {Provider} provider, commonly when "start search" is called on the provider, to when the search results are received from the provider, commonly when the provider calls our provided callback for search results. If a request is cancelled before a search result is returned, this histogram is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.Session.InputReadyLatency
histogram.summary: The delay from when the user triggered the picker to when the picker search field is focused for the first time. If the picker is triggered by an accelerator, the start time is calculated as the event timestamp of the accelerator. Recorded when the picker search field receives focus for the first time.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.Session.Outcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of a Picker session to record how a user finished a session. Recorded when the Picker widget is destroyed.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.Session.PresentationLatency.SearchField
histogram.summary: The delay from when the search field content changes to when the next frame in the widget is presented to the screen. If multiple content changes result in the same frame being presented, the delay is calculated from the first content change. Recorded whenever the picker search field contents changes and a frame is successfully presented to the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.Session.PresentationLatency.SearchResults
histogram.summary: The delay from when the search results are updated to when the next frame in the widget is presented to the screen. If multiple content changes result in the same frame being presented, the delay is calculated from the first content change. Recorded whenever the picker publishes search results and a frame is successfully presented to the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.Session.SearchLatency
histogram.summary: The delay from when the search field content changes to when the search results are received. If multiple content changes happen before search results are received, the time is calculated from the latest content change. Recorded whenever search results are received and there was a content change before that.

histogram.name: Ash.Picker.TimeToFirstGifFrame
histogram.summary: The time it takes to download and decode the first frame of a GIF in Picker. Recorded starting at when the download request is issued, ending at when a ImageView is set with the first frame (of either a preview thumbnail or the full GIF).

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.DialogClosed
histogram.summary: Emitted whenever the informed restore dialog closes.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.DialogScreenshotVisibility
histogram.summary: Emits true if the informed restore dialog is shown with a shutdown screenshot inside. Emits false if the informed restore dialog is shown with the app lists view inside.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.OnboardingDialog.TurnRestoreOn
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when the onboarding dialog is shown and the user had Restore off. Emits true if the user accepted the dialog and turned Restore to 'Ask every time', false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.ScreenshotDecodeDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to fetch the shutdown screenshot from the disk and decode it.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.ScreenshotEncodeAndSaveDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to encode and save the screenshot to the disk that we captured on shutdown.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.ScreenshotOnShutdownStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded the status on taking the screenshot on shutdown. The recorded enum indicates it succeededs or failed with specific reason.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.ScreenshotTakenDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to capture a screenshot of the active desk on shutdown. This screenshot will only be taken if there are windows opened in the desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Pine.TimeToAction.{PineContentsType}
histogram.summary: The amount of time in ms that user takes from when they see the pine contents view begin to fade in, to when they click the restore or cancel buttons.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.AndroidPipUseTime
histogram.summary:
How long Android PIP was used for, upon ending the session.
This metric was expired between April 2022 and July 2023 and may be missing data.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.Events
histogram.summary:
Various individiual Picture-in-picture related events. See AshPipEvents.
This metric was expired between April 2022 and July 2023 and may be missing data.

histogram.name: Ash.PostLoginGlanceables.HypotheticalFetchEvent.{Delay}
histogram.summary:
Recorded any time a code path is triggered which would require post login glanceable data to be fetched and/or displayed to the user. This histogram is meant to be used for estimating how often we would typically want to fetch and then show this data.
This histogram is split by different variants. The "No Delay" variant is the raw query rate, while the other delay variants are to experiment with throttling, where the metric will not be recorded more than once within any single 15/30 second or 5/15/30 minute time span.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerNotification.CriticalNotificationOutcome
histogram.summary: Record the outcome after a critical battery notification appears.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerNotification.CriticalNotificationToOutcomeDuration.{Outcome}
histogram.summary: Record the time interval from when a critical battery notification appears to when an outcome such as plugging in, user-initiated shutdown, automatic shutdown due to low battery, suspension or crash occurs.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerNotification.TimeToEmptyForCritialState
histogram.summary: Record the remaining battery time when the status changes to critical and the corresponding notification is displayed. This metric is recorded only once per transition to critical state.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerNotification.TimeToEmptyPluggedIn
histogram.summary: Record the remaining battery time when the device transitions from a critical state to charging state upon connecting the charger. Fires at the moment charger is connected.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerSoundsController.PluggedInBatteryLevel
histogram.summary: Record the battery level when a charger is connected and the battery status is from discharging to charging.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerSoundsController.UnpluggedBatteryLevel
histogram.summary: Record the battery level when a charger is unplugged and the battery status is from charging to discharging.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the privacy indicators view animation. This occurs when an app is accessing camera/microphone or screen sharing and a green indicator appears on the status area button. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.AppAccessUpdate.Type
histogram.summary: Record the type of the app that change the status of camera/microphone access. Emitted when there is any change in the status of camera/microphone access.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.IndicatorShowsDuration
histogram.summary: Record the duration of showing for privacy indicators. Emitted when the privacy indicators view is hidden after a show in the status tray.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.LaunchSettings
histogram.summary: Record the type of the app that associate with the privacy indicators notification whose settings button is clicked. Emitted when the user click on the settings button of that notification.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfAppsAccessingCamera
histogram.summary: Record the number of apps that access the camera at the same time. Emitted when there are one or more apps accessing the camera.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfAppsAccessingMicrophone
histogram.summary: Record the number of apps that access the microphone at the same time. Emitted when there are one or more apps accessing the microphone.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfShowsPerSession
histogram.summary: Record the number of times that the tray indicator shows in the tray per session. Emitted when there is a change in user session.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.ShowType
histogram.summary: Record the type of privacy indicators shown. Emitted when the privacy indicators view is shown in the status tray.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.Source
histogram.summary: Record the source that use privacy indicators. Emitted when there's a client calling into the function that updates the privacy indicators.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.{Icon}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the privacy indicators {Icon} fade in animation. This occurs when an app is accessing camera/microphone or screen sharing and a green indicator appears on the status area button.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.CreationFlow.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Tracks how the user progresses through the creation flow in {TabletOrClamshell}, recorded each time the user starts or ends a screencast recording.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.CreationFlowError.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Tracks the most common errors during the screencast recording creation process in {TabletOrClamshell}, recorded each time an error occurs.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.MarkerColor.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user chooses a marker color on the Projector toolbar in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric records when the user changes the color or when the annotator toggles on, to record the saved last used color.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.OnDeviceToServerSpeechRecognitionFallbackReason
histogram.summary: Records the fallback reason of using server based speech recognition instead of on device speech recogniton. This metric is recorded on server based speech recognition in projector session.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.PendingScreencastBatchIOTaskDuration
histogram.summary: Tracks the processing time of batch pending screencast files validation on IO thread. Recorded each time when IO task finishes.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.PendingScreencastChangeInterval
histogram.summary: Tracks the interval between UI updates during screencast uploading. Recorded at each pending screencast's UI change except for the first one of current uploading phase.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.SpeechRecognitionEndState.{Location}
histogram.summary: For a recognition session happening at {Location}, this histogram records the recognition status at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.Toolbar.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user opens, closes, or presses a button the Projector toolbar in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.TranscriptsCount.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of transcripts generated during a recording in {TabletOrClamshell}, recorded each time the metadata file saved successfully after a recording ends.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.Button.Activated
histogram.summary: Recorded when any button in the quick settings view is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.FeaturePod.{FeaturePodBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any FeaturePod in the quick settings view. {FeaturePodBehavior} can be a toggle to enable the feature, toggle to disable this feature, going to the feature's detailed page, or making the button visible.

variant.name: DiveIn
variant.summary: Go to the feature's detailed page

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.PageCountOnClose
histogram.summary: The number of quick settings pagination pages in the new quick settings UI. This metric is recorded each time the quick settings are closed. Note that this will also get recorded when the user opens and then closes the status area calendar (even if they never viewed the quick settings), until b/285280977 is fixed.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.Slider.{SliderBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any slider in the quick settings view or in the slider bubble. {SliderBehavior} can be changing the value or toggling to enable the feature.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.UserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: Records time user spent in Quick Settings opened through the Status Area button. Starts measuring time whenever the QS bubble is opened, and records metric when the QS bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen
histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. This metric is logged by 2 different types of {DeviceMode}: "Clamshell" and "Tablet".

histogram.name: Ash.Report.InitializerState
histogram.summary: Recorded after browser startup for each state that the report initializer enters. Each state in the initializer is a precondition check, such as device settings being owned, start up delay wait, oobe being completed, and device policies being trusted. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsActivateDateSet
