histogram.summary: Record whether the ActivateDate was read from VPD and parsed successfully. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, when the device attempts to report the churn monthly cohort use case. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsLastPowerwashTimeRead
histogram.summary: Record success when the last powerwash time file is read successfully. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, while checking the preconditions of whether to initialize the ReportController. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsOobeCompleted
histogram.summary: Record success when the oobe completed file was created more than 1 minute from when the oobe file stat is read. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, while checking the preconditions of whether to initialize the ReportController. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsPsmSecretSet
histogram.summary: Record whether the Psm Secret key is successfully read and parsed from VPD. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, while checking the preconditions of whether to initialize the ReportController. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsPsm{PsmUseCase}OprfResponseBodySet
histogram.summary: Record success if the PSM OPRF response for {PsmUseCase} contains a value. This network request is called after browser start if the last ping timestamp of the Chromebook is not known. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsPsm{PsmUseCase}OprfResponseParsedCorrectly
histogram.summary: Record success if the PSM OPRF response for {PsmUseCase} is able to be parsed correctly. This network request is called after browser start if the last ping timestamp of the Chromebook is not known. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsSystemClockSynced
histogram.summary: Recorded if the system clock is synced successfully. This histogram is recorded after browser start up and after ReportController is initialized and connected to the network. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsTestDevice
histogram.summary: Recorded as true if the ChromeOS device is a VM or in Cros Debug mode. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, while checking the preconditions of whether to initialize the ReportController. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.MarketSegment
histogram.summary: Record the market segment assigned to the ChromeOS device after oobe is completed. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.PreservedFileReadAndParsed
histogram.summary: Record whether the preserved file read and successfully parsed all known last active UTC dates. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.PreservedFileWritten
histogram.summary: Record whether the preserved file was written successfully over DBus for last active UTC dates. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, when the device attempts to read the preserved file storing the last known UTC dates. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.PsmQueryMembershipResult
histogram.summary: Record whether the private set membership query response contains queried ID that is known or not known. This histogram is recorded after the check membership request is fulfilled by the Fresnel server. The response code indicates whether the queried ID is present in the privacy complaint PSM database. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.Psm{PsmUseCase}{PsmRequest}ResponseNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Emit the NetError code associated with the {PsmUseCase} {PsmRequest} response. Network requests are called after the browser is instantiated and the device is connected to the internet. Enum for histogram will contain 0 - 899. Ranges are defined //net/base/net_error_list.h;l=14-23. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.StartupDelay
histogram.summary: Records the time delay before Fresnel reporting should start, based on the first chrome run time. Reporting starts if the device has been running for greater than 1 hour. A 1 hour threshold is used to give the device enough time to avoid spurious check membership requests to the PSM server after device powerwash. ChromeOS Only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.TrustedStatus
histogram.summary: Record the device policy trusted status assigned to the ChromeOS device. This is recorded after browser startup and after the oobe completed file was written for at least 1 minute. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.{PsmUseCase}.IsDevicePingRequired
histogram.summary: Record true if the {PsmUseCase} triggers a ping on a specific day. This happens when the device has not sent a ping within the reporting window, as the device only pings once per period. For instance, in the 1DA use case, this histogram is recorded once per day to avoid duplicate pings. This histogram is recorded after browser start depending on the last ping timestamp of the Chromebook. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.{PsmUseCase}CheckMembershipCases
histogram.summary: Record the number of different failed/success cases for the {PsmUseCase} check membership process. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Rotation.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when rotating screen. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user rotates the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.ScannerFeature.Timer.{Type}
histogram.summary: Measures the time between the start of a request for {Type} and when a response is recieved.

variant.name: ExecutePopulatedNewCalendarEventAction
variant.summary: when a new calendar event action is executed

variant.name: ExecutePopulatedNewContactAction
variant.summary: when new contact action is executed

variant.name: ExecutePopulatedNewCopyToClipboardAction
variant.summary: when new copy to clipboard action is executed

variant.name: ExecutePopulatedNewGoogleDocAction
variant.summary: when new Google Doc action is executed

variant.name: ExecutePopulatedNewGoogleSheetAction
variant.summary: when new Google Sheet action is executed

variant.name: FetchActionsForImage
variant.summary: when a image is sent to fetch actions via scanner server

variant.name: PopulateNewCalendarEventAction
variant.summary: when new calendar action is sent to server to be populated

variant.name: PopulateNewContactAction
variant.summary: when new contact action is sent to server to be populated

variant.name: PopulateNewCopyToClipboardAction
variant.summary: when new copy to clipboard action is sent to server to be populated

variant.name: PopulateNewGoogleDocAction
variant.summary: when new Google Doc action is sent to server to be populated

variant.name: PopulateNewGoogleSheetAction
variant.summary: When new Google Sheet action is sent to server to be populated

histogram.name: Ash.ScannerFeature.UserState
histogram.summary: This histogram captures user interaction and states as a user uses the Scanner feature.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Api.Thumbnails.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of thumbnails received. Only recorded if API status code is kOk.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Api.Wallpaper.HasImage
histogram.summary: Records if an image is received. Only recorded if API status code is kOk. Recorded for SeaPen Wallpaper.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Api.{Type}.Latency
histogram.summary: API latency after clicking Create or Inspire Me button in VC Background or SeaPen Wallpaper. Only recorded if thumbnails were successfully retrieved.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Api.{Type}.MantaStatusCode
histogram.summary: Records the returned Manta status code for thumbnails or wallpaper. Only recorded if the request completed before the enforced timeout.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Api.{Type}.Timeout
histogram.summary: Records if the request hits the enforced timeout.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.CreateButton
histogram.summary: Records the user's selected template when they create SeaPen thumbnails. Record for both SeaPen VC Background and Wallpaper.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Api.Thumbnails.Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of thumbnails received for a freeform query. Only recorded if API status code is kOk.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Api.Wallpaper.HasImage
histogram.summary: Records if an image is received for a freeform query. Only recorded if API status code is kOk. Recorded for SeaPen Wallpaper.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Api.{Type}.Latency
histogram.summary: API latency after clicking Create or Inspire Me button in VC Background or SeaPen Wallpaper for a freeform query. Only recorded if thumbnails were successfully retrieved.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Api.{Type}.MantaStatusCode
histogram.summary: Records the returned Manta status code for thumbnails or wallpaper for a freeform query. Only recorded if the request completed before the enforced timeout.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Api.{Type}.Timeout
histogram.summary: Records if the request for a freeform query hits the enforced timeout.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.SamplePrompt.SampleClicked
histogram.summary: Emmitted when the user clicks a sample prompt for a freeform query.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.SamplePrompt.Shuffle.Clicked
histogram.summary: Emmitted when the user shuffles the sample prompts for a freeform query.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Suggestion.Clicked
histogram.summary: Emmitted when the user clicks a suggestion for a freeform query.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Suggestion.Shuffle.Clicked
histogram.summary: Emmitted when the user shuffles the suggestions for a freeform query.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.Tab.Clicked
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user clicks on a freeform tab.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.{AppName}.RecentImage.ActionMenu
histogram.summary: Record the action menu item click for SeaPen recent image generated from free text query of each {AppName} from the user.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.{AppName}.Visited
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user navigates to the Freeform SeaPen page in the {AppName} App.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.{AppName}.{Source}.ImageSet
histogram.summary: Emmitted when the user sets a {Source} SeaPen image that generated from free text query as {AppName}.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.Template
histogram.summary: Records the user's selected template when they navigates to the template subpage.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.ThumbnailClicked
histogram.summary: Records the template ID of the image when the user clicks a thumbnail to set it as their VC Background or Wallpaper.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.WordCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of words in the SeaPen text query when the user clicks the create button.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.{AppName}.RecentImage.ActionMenu
histogram.summary: Record the action menu item click for SeaPen recent image of each {AppName} from the user.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.{AppName}.Visited
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user navigates to the SeaPen page in the {AppName} App. This metric is not emitted for the freeform page -- the freeform page emits `Ash.SeaPen.Freeform.{AppName}.Visited`.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.{AppName}.{Source}.ImageSet
histogram.summary: Emmitted when the user sets a {Source} SeaPen image as {AppName}.

histogram.name: Ash.SeaPen.{TemplateName}.UserFeedback
Ash.Search.DriveFileSuggestDataValidation.Status
histogram.summary: The outcome of drive file suggestion data validation. Recorded once per validation.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.DurationOnError.{SearchType}
histogram.summary: The duration of failed local Drive FS search when generating file suggestions based on recent drive activity. The suggestions are generated on demand when the user opens a supported UI surface - e.g. continue section in the launcher. The suggestions are generated by performing multiple queries on Drive FS. {SearchType} describes the type of query the search is handling.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.DurationOnSuccess.{SearchType}
histogram.summary: The duration of successful local Drive FS search when generating file suggestions based on recent drive activity. The suggestions are generated on demand when the user opens a supported UI surface - e.g. continue section in the launcher. The suggestions are generated by performing multiple queries on Drive FS. {SearchType} describes the type of query the search is handling. "Total" variant records the total time needed to generate file suggestions.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.FirstSharedSuggestionIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the first file suggested because it was shared with user in the ordered list of drive file suggestions based on the local Drive FS search. The suggestions are, for example, displayed in Launcher Continue Section.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.FolderCount.{SearchType}
histogram.summary: The number of folder items returned by local Drive FS search while generating file suggestions based on recent drive activity. The suggestions are generated on demand when the user opens a supported UI surface - e.g. continue section in the launcher. The suggestions are generated by performing multiple queries on Drive FS. {SearchType} describes the type of query the search is handling.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.ItemCount.{SearchType}
histogram.summary: The number of items returned by local Drive FS search while generating file suggestions based on recent drive activity. The suggestions are generated on demand when the user opens a supported UI surface - e.g. continue section in the launcher. The suggestions are generated by performing multiple queries on Drive FS. {SearchType} describes the type of query the search is handling. "Total" variant records the total number of generated suggestions.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.ModifyingUserMetadataPresent
histogram.summary: Whether a drive file returned by local drive FS search while generating file suggestions based on recent drive activity (used for example in launcher continue section) contains last modifying user metadata. Recorded while generating file suggestions for each file suggestion that's surfaced because it's been recently modified, in which case the suggestion justification string depends on last modifying user metadata.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.FileSuggestions.DriveRecents.QueryResult.{SearchType}
histogram.summary: The result of a local Drive FS query operation performed while generating file suggestions based on recent drive activity. The suggestions are generated on demand when the user opens a supported UI surface - e.g. continue section in the launcher. The suggestions are generated by performing multiple queries on Drive FS.

histogram.name: Ash.SearchModelUpdateTime.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the time interval between user-initiated search model updates after the user starts a search query. Used to record how quickly users update the search model in {TabletOrClamshell} after the first keystroke.

histogram.name: Ash.SearchResultUpdateAnimationShortened
histogram.summary: Records whether search result animation times were shorted for recent search result update animation preemptions. Recorded when productivity launcher search containers' results change while result containers are still animating.

histogram.name: Ash.ServerBasedSpeechRecognition.AudioLengthLeftWhenAudioCaptureEnd
histogram.summary: Records the length of remaining un-transcribed audio when the audio capture stops.

histogram.name: Ash.ServerBasedSpeechRecognition.EndOfRecognitionSignalLatency
histogram.summary: Records the time user needs to wait to get the final speech recognition result after audio capture stops.

histogram.name: Ash.ServerBasedSpeechRecognition.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Records the network error or HTTP response code of server based speech recognition request when an an error occurred.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.DefaultApps.Pinned
histogram.summary: Records the default apps that are pinned to the shelf. This metric is recorded with every UMA log upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.NumItemsEnabledUponSelection
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of menu items that are enabled in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-08-13 to 2025-02-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.SelectedMenuItemIndex
histogram.summary: Tracks the index of the selected menu item in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfItems
histogram.summary: The number of icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfPinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of pinned icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfUnpinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of unpinned icons in the shelf. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShowStackedHotseat
histogram.summary: Show stacked hotseat app bar above the shelf button panels/system tray when there is no enough space for the app bar.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.Action
histogram.summary: Track actions on the shutdown confirmation bubble, if it's opened, dismissed or which buttons are clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.TimeToNextBoot.LoginShutdownToPowerUpDuration
histogram.summary:
Emitted at device start-up if a shut-down was previously initiated from the shelf shutdown button. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf shutdown button was pressed and the device was powered up again soon after that.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-09-10 to 2024-04-24; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenWindowMinimizedAndActivatedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time between a window being minimized by the shelf and subsequently activated. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf button pressed action causes a window to be minimized and the very next shelf button pressed action causes the same window to be activated.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentUsage
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) when the shelf launcher is used to launch an app/window/etc, this is used instead of log in to give data on users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfIcon.AnimationSmoothness{ShelfIconAnimationType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the shelf icons. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Recorded when shelf icon animations are completed, including icon move, icon fade-in and icon fade-out. {ShelfIconAnimationType}

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.AddAccelerator.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record which accelerator is added by the user for {ActionName}. This metric also includes accelerators added from editing an accelerator. A shortcut is encoded as an int where the high 16 bits represent all the modifiers used, and the 0-15 bits represent which key is used.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.AddAcceleratorSubactions
histogram.summary: Tracks the subactions that can occur when the user attempts to add a custom accelerator.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.CustomizationAction
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a shortcut customization action has taken place from the Key Shortcuts App.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.CustomizationsBeforeResetAll
histogram.summary: Record the number of customizations before the user resets their shortcuts to default.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.CustomizationsLoadedOnStartup
histogram.summary: Record the number of customized accelerator modifications on startup.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.EditAcceleratorSubactions
histogram.summary: Tracks the subactions that can occur when the user attempts to edit an accelerator.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.EditDialogCompletedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the actions done in the accelerator edit dialog before it was closed. If an action has been done at least once it will count towards the appropriate enum. Enums are formatted such that they are ordered in a bitwise manner. 0000: no action, 0001: Add, 0010: Edit, 0100: Remove, 1000: Reset.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.MainCategoryNavigation
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a user navigates to a main category in the side panel of the Key Shortcuts app.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.ModifyType.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record what modification actions that were done for {ActionName}.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.RemoveDefaultAccelerator.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record which default accelerator is removed by the user for {ActionName}. A shortcut is encoded as an int where the high 16 bits represent all the modifiers used, and the 0-15 bits represent which key is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow2{Stage}
histogram.summary:
Tracks the percent of dropped frames in a 1 second sliding window.
PercentDroppedFrames is measured by tracking the number of frames which were not displayed on screen out of the total number of frames expected to be produced and displayed. In other words, the lower this number is, the smoother experience.
The ".InSession" covers the time of 1 minute beyond into user sessions. The 1 minute timeline is picked based on "Ash.Login.TimeUntilGoodADF" histogram, where about 93-94% user sessions fall under the 1 minute bar.
The metric is reported {Stage}.

variant.name: .InSession
variant.summary: on every frame after 1 min into session

histogram.name: Ash.Snap.CloseTwoWindowsDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between a first snapped window getting closed and a second snapped window getting closed. Starts recording when a snapped window is closed. Ends recording when a snapped window on the opposite side is closed, or if a snapped window on the opposite side is unsnapped, records the maximum value of 50 hours (18000 seconds).

histogram.name: Ash.Snap.MinimizeTwoWindowsDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between a first snapped window getting minimized and a second snapped window getting minimized. Starts recording when a window changes state from snapped to minimized. Ends recording when a second window changes state from snapped to minimized, or if the first window is no longer snapped on the same side, records the maximum value of 50 hours (18000 seconds).

histogram.name: Ash.Snap.SnapTwoWindowsDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between a first window getting snapped and a second window getting snapped on the other side. Starts recording when one window gets snapped. Ends recording when another window is snapped on the other side of the screen, or if the first window is no longer snapped on the same side, records the maximum value of 50 hours (18000 seconds).

histogram.name: Ash.SnapGroups.SnapGroupActualDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of a Snap Group where the two snapped windows remain unchanged throughout its existence.

histogram.name: Ash.SnapGroups.SnapGroupExitPoint
histogram.summary: Records the exit point of a Snap Group.

histogram.name: Ash.SnapGroups.SnapGroupPersistenceDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of a Snap Group where one of the windows remains in the Snap Group even after the other window is replaced using 'Snap to Replace'.

histogram.name: Ash.SnapGroups.SnapGroupsCount
histogram.summary: Emitted when there's a change in the number of snap groups, i.e. a group is added or removed. Specifies the number of available snap groups.

histogram.name: Ash.SnapWindowSuggestions.{SnapSource}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the time a window is snapped via a snap action source that can start faster split view. Emits true if faster split view is enabled, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.SpeechRecognitionSessionLength.{Location}
histogram.summary: The length of the speech recognition session happening on {Location}. This histogram records the length at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.DeviceOrientation.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at entry to split view mode and each time the orientation or the device mode changes to report whether the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode and whether the orientation is landscape or portrait.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceUIMode
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.OrientationInSplitView
histogram.summary: Emitted when device orientation changes in split view, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom). Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-11-12 to 2024-03-11; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.ResizeWindowCount.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of resizing window operations in split view mode session for both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.SwapWindowCount
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of swap window operations in split view mode session.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInMultiDisplaySplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in multi-display split view mode, meaning that split view is active on more than one display. The time is measured from when the number of displays in split view becomes more than one to when it drops back down to one.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInSplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in split view mode. The time is measured from the moment a window is snapped to one side of the screen to when split view mode is ended.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.{EngagementTime}.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode or the point of switching between clamshell mode and tablet mode in split view, to report the engagement time of general split view and multi-display split view in both clamshell mode and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.SelectedWindowIndex
histogram.summary: Records the index of the selected window in partial overview. Starts indexing at 0.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.WindowLayoutCompleteOnSessionExit.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the exit point of the split view overview session in {TabletOrClamshell}. Emits true if the window layout setup is complete, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.WindowListSize
histogram.summary: Records the total number of windows in partial overview when a window is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.{SnapSource}.ExitPoint.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the exit point of the split view overview session in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum indicates the reason that triggers the split view overview session exit.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.AnimationSmoothness.DividerAnimation
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animation when releasing the split view divider, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime.MaxLatency{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

histogram.name: Ash.StateKeysPresent2
histogram.summary: The presense of state keys on first device policy fetch response. It is expected for state keys to be present. The histogram is logged only in case of successful device policy fetch response. This is replacing the old Ash.StateKeysPresent histogram because a bug made that data useless.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.BounceIn
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounce in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely bounced in and shown the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.FadeIn
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely faded in and shown the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely hidden in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.{State}
histogram.summary: Logged when: Hidden: a TrayBackgroundView's preferred visibility is set to false. Shown: a TrayBackgroundView's preferred visibility is set to true. Pressed: Logged when a TrayBackgroundView is activated, either showing a bubble or handling a custom action. The metric is expired from 2023-01-19 to 2023-03-15, so it's possible some data is dropped during that time.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayItemView.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the hide animation of tray item view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the tray item is completely hidden in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayItemView.Show
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the show animation of tray item view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the tray item is completely shown in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusAreaShowBubble.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while opening QuickSettings and Notification Center through Status Area button. Emitted when QuickSettings and Notification Center are opened and shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Style.ColorPalette.KMeansAlgorithm
histogram.summary: Whether or not to use the kmeans algorithm to determine the user's color palette. This metric is recorded once per UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeHomeToOverviewGesture
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether a swipe from hotseat on home screen resulted in a transition to overview.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.PercentageOfWorkAreaHeightCoveredByMenu
histogram.summary: The height of the system menu divided by the height of the Ash desktop work area; a value over 100% indicates that a portion of the system menu is not visible to the user. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.Rows
histogram.summary: The number of user-visible rows in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a tab is dragged. In clamshell mode, each time a tab is dragged within a display, the time it takes to present the new frame on screen is recorded. In tablet mode (with webui tab strip enable), dragging between displays is precluded, thus each time a tab is dragged, the time it takes to present the new frame to screen is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum presentation time recorded during a tab dragging session in both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Enter
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when entering tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Exit
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.LidAngle
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. The computed angle between the lid and the keyboard panel. These values are imprecise and may be tens of degrees off from reality. Reported once per hour that the system is awake, and not reported if the system doesn't have two accelerometers.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActive
histogram.summary: The length of time that TouchView is active, for each activation.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActivePercentage
histogram.summary: The proportion of time spent in TouchView during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactive
histogram.summary: The length of time between TouchView activations. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-03-19 to 2023-11-06; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is not active during a session. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-03-19 to 2023-11-06; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the unlock process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second. The metric was expired from 2022-04-18 to 2023-07-12 (revived in M117), it's possible some data was dropped during that time.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.TotalSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the entire profile data directory. Collected upon launching ash chrome.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.{ItemName}
histogram.summary: Records the size of each file/dir directly under user data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.NumberOfRepeatedShows
histogram.summary: Record the number of times that the video conference tray repeatedly shows per 100ms. Emitted when the sequence of consecutive shows in the video conference tray has finished.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.ReturnToApp.Click
histogram.summary: Records the app type of the media app that users want to return to when they click the return to app button in the video conference panel.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.ReturnToAppButton.FadeOut.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade out animation of the return to app button inside the video conference controls. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade out animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.ReturnToAppPanel.BoundsChange.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounds change animation of the return to app panel inside the video conference controls. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the bounds change animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.{ViewName}.FadeIn.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of the {ViewName} inside the video conference controls. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.BackgroundBlur.Click
histogram.summary: Records the background blur state that users want to switch to when they choose a different value for background blur effect in the tab slider of the video conference panel.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.BackgroundBlur.InitialState
histogram.summary: Records the initial state of background blur when the Video Conference Panel is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.BackgroundImageButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the background image button in video conference tray is clicked to apply background image replace.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.CreateWithAiButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Create with AI" button in video conference tray is clicked to open VcBackgroundApp.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.StopScreenShareButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the stop screen share button in video conference tray is clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.ToggleBubbleButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the toggle bubble button in video conference tray is clicked to open/close the bubble.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.{Device}MuteButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the {Device} mute button in video conference tray is clicked. We will record if the user clicks the button to mute or to un-mute the {Device}.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.{EffectName}.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the toggle button of {EffectName} in the video conference bubble is clicked. We will record if the user clicks the button to enable or disable the effect.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.{EffectName}.InitialState
histogram.summary: Records the initial state of {EffectName} when the Video Conference Panel is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Collection
histogram.summary: The wallpaper collection of the selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Collection.Settled
histogram.summary: The wallpaper collection of the online image currently set as the active wallpaper. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.CustomLayout
histogram.summary: The custom wallpaper layout type. Recorded when the user sets a new custom wallpaper or changes the existing custom wallpaper's layout.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.DecodedSizeMB
histogram.summary: Records the size of the decoded wallpaper that is cached in memory for the entire duration of the ChromeOS session. This applies to all wallpaper types and layouts. It's recorded every time a wallpaper is loaded (ex: on boot), and every time the wallpaper changes. Kilobyte granularity is unnecessary as this metric is solely to validate a theory that the wallpaper typically only occupies several megabytes of memory, rather than something on the order of 20-40. After this theory is validated, this metric can be removed. It has a 50 MB maximum.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.RefreshCount
histogram.summary: Records the refresh count for the request of the Google Photos API which {Api} with a valid refresh token. The count increases each time a user scrolls down to the end of the page to fetch more photos or albums from the Google Photos API. Emitted only at the end of a session.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.ResponseTime.{Result}
histogram.summary: Records the response time for the {Result} request to the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted only on {Result} parsing of the API response at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result for the request to the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted for both failed and successful parsing of the API request at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.Result.Count
histogram.summary: Records the result count for the response of the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted only on successful parsing of the API response at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Source2
histogram.summary: Records the section of the Wallpaper App from which a Google Photos wallpaper was selected. Emitted regardless of the selection's success.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image
histogram.summary: The selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image.Settled
histogram.summary: The online image currently set as the active wallpaper. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image.Settled.HasCollectionId
histogram.summary: Whether the current online image currently set as the active wallpaper has the collection_id field. Older versions of ChromeOS (pre M107) did not set this field, so this metric tracks how many users selected an older online wallpaper and have not updated it since. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image.Settled.HasUnitId
histogram.summary: Whether the current online image currently set as the active wallpaper has the unit_id field. Older versions of ChromeOS (pre M107) did not set this field, so this metric tracks how many users selected an older online wallpaper and have not updated it since.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.IsSetToTimeOfDayAfterOobe
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the time of day wallpaper is set to be the default wallpaper successfully on supported devices. Recorded each time the user goes through OOBE flow and they did not have any synced wallpaper on any of their previous devices.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.MigrationFailureReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason for the versioned wallpaper migration failure. Recorded when the migration fails on user's login.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Online.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of user's attempt to set a wallpaper. Recorded when a user selects a wallpaper from the personalization hub. b/285387348: Add more variants and fix incorrect metric recording for online wallpapers.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Preview.Show
histogram.summary: Tracks the preview mode usage for wallpaper. Recorded each time the wallpaper image is previewed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.SeaPen.Template.Settled
histogram.summary: The template of the Sea Pen image currently set as the active wallpaper. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Source2
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user attempts to set a wallpaper, either by the built-in Wallpaper App, or by a third party App. Note the wallpaper change triggered by Sync file system event doesn't count.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Type
histogram.summary:
The wallpaper type. Recorded at user login.
This metric expired in April 2022 and was revived in August 2022. Data between these times is incomplete.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.{Type}.MigrationLatency
histogram.summary: Tracks the latency of migration for wallpaper info of type {Type}. Recorded after the migration is completed on user's login.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.{Type}.MigrationStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the status of migration for wallpaper info of type {Type}. Recorded after the migration is completed on user's login.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.{Type}.Result2
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of user's attempt to set a wallpaper of type {Type}. Replaces the previous Result histogram where there is a misreport of online wallpapers. Recorded when a user selects a {Type} wallpaper from the personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of cross fade animation when setting window bounds. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when SetBoundsDirectCrossFade is called, such as when window is maximized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragMaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. Dragging the window back to the top of the screen will expand the window. This histogram is fired only if the window is initially maximized. If we drag a normal window to maximized state, the animation smoothness will be recorded in the regular cross fade histogram above. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothenss of the expand animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragUnmaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. This histogram is fired everytime we drag a maximized window to normal state. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothness of the shrink animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of hiding window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindowCommon is called, such as when window is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Minimize
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of minimizing window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindow_Minimize is called, such as when window is minimized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Snap
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of snapping window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when a window is snapped to the left or right in clamshell mode using the alt + [ or ] accelerator, but only if the size of the window's bounds change.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Unminimize
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of unminimizing window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateShowWindow_Minimize is called, such as when window is unminimized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.DragMaximized.NumberOfMisTriggers
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window state is being destroyed. Records number of mis-triggers of the drag to maximize behavior for a window during its lifetime.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.DragMaximized.Valid
histogram.summary: This boolean keeps tracking if a drag to maximize behavior is valid or not. Emits true if a window is dragged to maximized and stays maximized status over 5 seconds. If a window is dragged to maximized, but gets restored during 5 seconds, the drag to maximize behavior should be considered as invalid and a mis-trigger.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.PartialSplitDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time a user keeps a partial split window open and visible. Starts recording when a user partial splits through the multitask menu, or activates a desk that contains a partial window. Ends recording when the window is closed, changes window state, is snapped/dragged/resized to a non-partial snap ratio, gets moved to an inactive desk, or a different desk is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.Snap.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user snaps the window to record whether window snap is used while the display orientation is portrait or landscape mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.DesksSwitchDistance
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user ends window cycling via Alt-Tab, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and a new window was activated, to report the distance between the active desks before and after window cycling. A distance of 0 means no desks switch occurred.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.Enter.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the window cycle event (alt+tab) was received to when the next frame is shown to the user. This does not include the 150ms delay for window cycle (for users who switch so fast they do not need the UI).

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.InitialMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user starts Alt-Tab, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the initial alt-tab mode, which signals user's saved and preferred mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.Items
histogram.summary: The number of windows in the Alt+Tab selector. Only recorded once when cycling starts, not every time when Tab is pressed without releasing Alt.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.ModeSwitchSource
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user switches the Alt-Tab mode, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report whether the user switches the mode via a click or keyboard.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SameApp.DeskMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when same app window cycling ends, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the same-desk vs all-desk mode selection.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SameApp.IsSameApp
histogram.summary: Emits true when a same-app cycling session is started and false when a normal cycling session is started.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SameApp.SkippedWindows
histogram.summary: The number of windows the user didn't have to tab through because they were using Alt-Backtick instead of Alt-Tab. Recorded as the number of non-same-app windows in the ending MRU list between the starting and chosen window in the initial cycling direction.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SwitchMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user switches the Alt-Tab mode from a click or keyboard, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the alt-tab mode the user switches to.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between task switches triggered by the next window and previous window accelerator keys (ie Alt+Tab, Alt+Shift+Tab).

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.Container
histogram.summary:
Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the window cycle view moves the next window into position when alt + tab is pressed. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-04-10 to 2023-02-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.Show
histogram.summary:
Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the window cycle view starts. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-04-10 to 2023-02-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowDragFromShelfResult
histogram.summary: The final state after window drag gesture that started from the system shelf in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Success
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete. This does not include timeouts. Warning: this histogram was expired from M78 till M104 and from 2023-08-13 till 2024-04-24.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Timeout
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete, for timeouts only. Warning: this histogram was expired from M78 till M104. It was also expired from 2023-04-23 till 2023-07-10.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.MultiWindowResizerClick
histogram.summary: Emits true if the resize widget is clicked to start the resizing while in mulit-window resizing mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.MultiWindowResizerClickTwoWindowsSnapped
histogram.summary: Emits true if the resize widget is clicked to start the resizing while in mulit-window resizing mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.MultiWindowResizerShow
histogram.summary: Emits true if the resize widget shows on mouse hover on the ResizeWindows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.MultiWindowResizerShowTwoWindowsSnapped
histogram.summary: Emits true if the resize widget shows on mouse hover on the ResizeWindows and the two windows of the ResizeWindows are snapped.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.ActiveWindowAppType
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of the active application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.ActiveWindowSize
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window bounds type of the active application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.ActiveWindowState
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of the active application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.AllAppTypes
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of all opened application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.AllWindowSizes
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window bounds type of all opened application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.AllWindowStates
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of all opened application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.FreeformedWindowSizes
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window bounds type of freeformed application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutState.WindowNumbers
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the number of opened application windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateActiveWindowAppType
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of the active application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateActiveWindowSize
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window bounds type of the active application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateActiveWindowState
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of the active application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateAllAppTypes
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of all opened application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateAllWindowSizes
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window bounds type of all opened application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateAllWindowStates
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window states type of all opened application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateFreeformedWindowSizes
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the window bounds type of freeformed application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowLayoutStateWindowNumbers
histogram.summary: Emits every 30 minutes to report the number of opened application windows. This metrics should be removed after M127 stable is released.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSnapActionSource2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window is to be snapped. Records different ways for a user to snap a window.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSplitting.DragDuration.PerNoSplit
histogram.summary: Records the time duration a user spends dragging when a window is not split.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSplitting.DragDuration.PerSplit
histogram.summary: Records the time duration a user spends dragging when a window is split.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSplitting.DragType
histogram.summary: Records the number of times a window drag results in a window split compared to other outcomes.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSplitting.PreviewsShownCount.PerNoSplit
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the preview is shown when a window is not split.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSplitting.PreviewsShownCount.PerSplit
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the preview is shown when a window is split.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSplitting.SplitRegion
histogram.summary: Records the window region where a window is split.
